nfc llcp fix info leak via msg_name in llcp_sock_recvmsg the code in llcp_sock_recvmsg doe not initialize all the member of struct sockaddr_nfc_llcp when filling the sockaddr info nor doe it initialize the padding byte of the structure inserted by the compiler for alignment also if the socket is in state llcp_closed or is shutting down during receive the msg_namelen member is not updated to 0 while otherwise returning with 0 i e success the msg_namelen update is also missing for stream and seqpacket socket which don t fill the sockaddr info both issue lead to the fact that the code will leak uninitialized kernel stack byte in net socket c fix the first issue by initializing the memory used for sockaddr info with memset 0 fix the second one by setting msg_namelen to 0 early it will be updated later if we re going to fill the msg_name member cc lauro ramos venancio lauro venancio openbossa org cc aloisio almeida jr aloisio almeida openbossa org cc samuel ortiz sameo linux intel com signed off by mathias krause minipli googlemail com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

auth cephx add authorizer challenge allow the accepting side of a connection to reject an initial authorizer with a random challenge the connecting side then ha to respond with an updated authorizer proving they are able to decrypt the service s challenge and that the new authorizer wa produced for this specific connection instance the accepting side requires this challenge and response unconditionally if the client side advertises they have the feature bit server wishing to require this improved level of authentication simply have to require the appropriate feature signed off by sage weil sage redhat com cherry picked from commit f80b848d3f830eb6dba50123e04385173fa4540b conflict src auth auth h src auth cephx cephxprotocol cc src auth cephx cephxprotocol h src auth none authnoneprotocol h src msg dispatcher h src msg async asyncconnection cc const_iterator decode v decode asyncconnection ctor arg noise get_random_bytes not cct random

kdfa use openssl for hmac not tpm while not reachable in the current code base tool a potential security bug lurked in tpm_kdfa if using that routine for an hmac authorization the hmac wa calculated using the tpm a user of an object wishing to authenticate via hmac would expect that the password is never sent to the tpm however since the hmac calculation relies on password and is performed by the tpm the password end up being sent in plain text to the tpm the fix is to use openssl to generate the hmac on the host fix cve 2017 7524 signed off by william robert william c robert intel com

x86 x32 correct invalid use of user timespec in the kernel the x32 case for the recvmsg timout handling is broken asmlinkage long compat_sys_recvmmsg int fd struct compat_mmsghdr __user mmsg unsigned int vlen unsigned int flag struct compat_timespec __user timeout int datagrams struct timespec ktspec if flag msg_cmsg_compat return einval if compat_use_64bit_time return __sys_recvmmsg fd struct mmsghdr __user mmsg vlen flag msg_cmsg_compat struct timespec timeout the timeout pointer parameter is provided by userland hence the __user annotation but for x32 syscalls it s simply cast to a kernel pointer and is passed to __sys_recvmmsg which will eventually directly dereference it for both reading and writing other caller to __sys_recvmmsg properly copy from userland to the kernel first the bug wa introduced by commit ee4fa23c4bfc compat use compat_use_64bit_time in net compat c and should affect all kernel since 3 4 and perhaps vendor kernel if they backported x32 support along with this code note that config_x86_x32_abi get enabled at build time and only if config_x86_x32 is enabled and ld can build x32 executables other us of compat_use_64bit_time seem fine this address cve 2014 0038 signed off by pax team pageexec freemail hu signed off by h peter anvin hpa linux intel com cc stable vger kernel org v3 4 signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

futex fix error in nested key ref counting futex_wait is leaking key reference due to futex_wait_setup acquiring an additional reference via the queue_lock routine the nested key ref counting ha been masking bug and complicating code analysis queue_lock is only called with a previously ref counted key so remove the additional ref counting from the queue_ un lock function also futex_wait_requeue_pi drop one key reference too many in unqueue_me_pi remove the key reference handling from unqueue_me_pi this wa paired with a queue_lock in futex_lock_pi so the count remains unchanged document remaining nested key ref counting site signed off by darren hart dvhart linux intel com reported and tested by matthieu fertré matthieu fertre kerlabs com reported by louis rilling louis rilling kerlabs com cc peter zijlstra peterz infradead org cc eric dumazet eric dumazet gmail com cc john kacur jkacur redhat com cc rusty russell rusty rustcorp com au lkml reference 4cbb17a8 70401 linux intel com signed off by thomas gleixner tglx linutronix de cc stable kernel org

fix ldap key data segmentation cve 2014 4345 for principal entry having key with multiple kvnos due to use of keepold the ldap kdb module make an attempt to store all the key having the same kvno into a single krbprincipalkey attribute value there is a fencepost error in the loop causing currkvno to be set to the just processed value instead of the next kvno a a result the second and all following group of multiple key by kvno are each stored in two krbprincipalkey attribute value fix the loop to use the correct kvno value cve 2014 4345 in mit krb5 when kadmind is configured to use ldap for the kdc database an authenticated remote attacker can cause it to perform an out of bound write buffer overrun by performing multiple cpw keepold operation an off by one error while copying key information to the new database entry result in key sharing a common kvno being written to different array bucket in an array whose size is determined by the number of kvnos present after sufficient iteration the extra writes extend past the end of the null terminated array the null terminator is always written after the end of the loop so no out of bound data is read it is only written historically it ha been possible to convert an out of bound write into remote code execution in some case though the necessary exploit must be tailored to the individual application and are usually quite complicated depending on the allocated length of the array an out of bound write may also cause a segmentation fault and or application crash cvssv2 vector av n ac m au s c c i c a c e poc rl of rc c ghudson mit edu clarified commit message kaduk mit edu cve summary cvssv2 vector cherry picked from commit 81c332e29f10887c6b9deb065f81ba259f4c7e03 ticket 7980 version_fixed 1 12 2 status resolved

unsquashfs 4 add more sanity check fix cve 2015 4645 6 add more filesystem table sanity check to unsquashfs 4 and also properly fix cve 2015 4645 and cve 2015 4646 the cf were raised due to unsquashfs having variable oveflow and stack overflow in a number of vulnerable function the suggested patch only fixed one such function and fixed it badly and so it wa buggy and introduced extra bug the suggested patch wa not only buggy but it used the essentially wrong approach too it wa fixing the symptom but not the cause the symptom is wrong value causing overflow the cause is filesystem corruption this corruption should be detected and the filesystem rejected before trying to allocate memory this patch applies the following fix 1 the filesystem super block table are checked and the value must match across the filesystem this will trap corrupted filesystems created by mksquashfs 2 the maximum theorectical size the filesystem table could grow to were analysed and some variable were increased from int to long long this analysis ha been added a comment 3 stack allocation wa removed and a shared buffer which is checked and increased a necessary is used to read the table index signed off by phillip lougher phillip squashfs org uk

delta fix sign extension of big left shift our delta code wa originally adapted from jgit which itself adapted it from git itself due to this heritage we inherited a bug from git git in how we compute the delta offset which wa fixed upstream in 48fb7deb5 fix big left shift of unsigned char 2009 06 17 a explained by linus shifting unsigned char or unsigned short left can result in sign extension error since the c integer promotion rule mean that the unsigned char short will get implicitly promoted to a signed int due to the shift or due to other operation this normally doesn t matter but if you shift thing up sufficiently it will now set the sign bit in int and a subsequent cast to a bigger type eg long or unsigned long will now sign extend the value despite the original expression being unsigned one example of this would be something like unsigned long size unsigned char c size c 24 where despite all the variable being unsigned c 24 end up being a signed entity and will get sign extended when then doing the addition in an unsigned long type since git us unsigned char pointer extensively we actually have this bug in a couple of place in our delta code we inherited such a bogus shift when computing the offset at which the delta base is to be found due to the sign extension we can end up with an offset where all the bit are set this can allow an arbitrary memory read a the addition in base_len off len can now overflow if off ha all it bit set fix the issue by casting the result of delta 24ul to an unsigned integer again add a test with a crafted delta that would actually succeed with an out of bound read in case where the cast wouldn t exist reported by riccardo schirone rschiron redhat com test provided by riccardo schirone rschiron redhat com

unused iocbs in a batch should not be accounted a active commit 69e4747ee9727d660b88d7e1efe0f4afcb35db1b upstream since commit 080d676de095 aio allocate kiocbs in batch iocbs are allocated in a batch during processing of first iocbs all iocbs in a batch are automatically added to ctx active_reqs list and accounted in ctx reqs_active if one not the last one of iocbs submitted by an user fails further iocbs are not processed but they are still present in ctx active_reqs and accounted in ctx reqs_active this cause process to stuck in a d state in wait_for_all_aios on exit since ctx reqs_active will never go down to zero furthermore since kiocb_batch_free free iocb without removing it from active_reqs list the list become corrupted which may cause oops fix this by removing iocb from ctx active_reqs and updating ctx reqs_active in kiocb_batch_free signed off by gleb natapov gleb redhat com reviewed by jeff moyer jmoyer redhat com signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh suse de

virt vbox only copy_from_user the request header once in vbg_misc_device_ioctl the header of the ioctl argument is copied from the userspace pointer arg and saved to the kernel object hdr then the version size_in and size_out field of hdr are verified before this commit after the check a buffer for the entire request would be allocated and then all data including the verified header would be copied from the userspace arg pointer again given that the arg pointer resides in userspace a malicious userspace process can race to change the data pointed to by arg between the two copy by doing so the user can bypass the verification on the ioctl argument this commit fix this by using the already checked copy of the header to fill the header part of the allocated buffer and only copying the remainder of the data from userspace signed off by wenwen wang wang6495 umn edu reviewed by han de goede hdegoede redhat com signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh linuxfoundation org

x86 mm 32 enable full randomization on i386 and x86_32 currently on i386 and on x86_64 when emulating x86_32 in legacy mode only the stack and the executable are randomized but not other mmapped file library vdso etc this patch enables randomization for the library vdso and mmap request on i386 and in x86_32 in legacy mode by default on i386 there are 8 bit for the randomization of the library vdso and mmaps which only us 1mb of va this patch preserve the original randomness using 1mb of va out of 3gb or 4gb we think that 1mb out of 3gb is not a big cost for having the aslr the first obvious security benefit is that all object are randomized not only the stack and the executable in legacy mode which highly increase the aslr effectiveness otherwise the attacker may use these non randomized area but also sensitive setuid setgid application are more secure because currently attacker can disable the randomization of these application by setting the ulimit stack to unlimited this is a very old and widely known trick to disable the aslr in i386 which ha been allowed for too long another trick used to disable the aslr wa to set the addr_no_randomize personality flag but fortunately this doesn t work on setuid setgid application because there is security check which clear security relevant flag this patch always randomizes the mmap_legacy_base address removing the possibility to disable the aslr by setting the stack to unlimited signed off by hector marco gisbert hecmargi upv e acked by ismael ripoll ripoll iripoll upv e acked by kees cook keescook chromium org acked by arjan van de ven arjan linux intel com cc linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org cc peter zijlstra peterz infradead org cc thomas gleixner tglx linutronix de cc akpm linux foundation org cc kees cook keescook chromium org link http lkml kernel org r 1457639460 5242 1 git send email hecmargi upv e signed off by ingo molnar mingo kernel org

set init process a non dumpable this set the init process that join and setup the container s namespaces a non dumpable before they setns to the container s pid or any other namespace this setting is automatically reset to the default after the exec in the container so that it doe not change functionality for the application that are running inside just our init process this prevents parent process the pid 1 of the container to ptrace the init process before it drop cap and other set lsms this patch also ensures that the statedirfd being used is still closed prior to exec even though it is set a o_cloexec because of the order in the kernel http github com torvalds linux blob v4 9 f exec c l1290 l1318 the order during the exec syscall is that the process is set back to dumpable before o_cloexec are processed signed off by michael crosby crosbymichael gmail com

wl 6791 redefine client ssl option to imply enforced encryption changed the meaning of the ssl 1 option of all client binary to mean force ssl not try ssl and fail over to eunecrypted added a new mysql_opt_ssl_enforce mysql_options option to specify that an ssl connection is required added a new macro ssl_set_options to the client ssl handling header that set all the relevant ssl option at once revamped all of the current native client to use the new macro removed some window line ending added proper handling of the new option into the ssl helper header if ssl is mandatory assume that the medium is secure enough for the sha256 plugin to do unencrypted password exchange even before establishing a connection set the default ssl cipher to dhe rsa aes256 sha if none is specified updated test case that require a non default cipher to spawn a mysql command line tool binary since mysqltest ha no support for specifying cipher updated the replication slave connection code to always enforce ssl if any of the ssl config option is present test case added and updated added a mysql_get_option api to return mysql_options value used the new api inside the sha256 plugin fixed compilation warning because of unused variable fixed test failure mysql_ssl and bug13115401 fixed whitespace issue fully implemented the mysql_get_option function added a test case for mysql_get_option fixed some trailing whitespace issue fixed some uint int warning in mysql_client_test c removed shared memory option from non window get_options test moved mysql_opt_local_infile to the uint option
revert bug 48615 yaml this reverts commit e7e6995be5713f0d37d3d5512497374bceb97076

audit fix a double fetch in audit_log_single_execve_arg there is a double fetch problem in audit_log_single_execve_arg where we first check the execve 2 argumnets for any bad character which would require hex encoding and then re fetch the argument for logging in the audit record 1 of course this leaf a window of opportunity for an unsavory application to munge with the data this patch reworks thing by only fetching the argument data once 2 into a buffer where it is scanned and logged into the audit record s in addition to fixing the double fetch this patch improves on the original code in a few other way better handling of large argument which require encoding stricter record length checking and some performance improvement completely unverified but we got rid of some strlen call that s got to be a good thing a part of the development of this patch i ve also created a basic regression test for the audit testsuite the test can be tracked on github at the following link http github com linux audit audit testsuite issue 25 1 if you pay careful attention there is actually a triple fetch problem due to a strnlen_user call at the top of the function 2 this is a tiny white lie we do make a call to strnlen_user prior to fetching the argument data i don t like it but due to the way the audit record is structured we really have no choice unless we copy the entire argument at once which would require a rather wasteful allocation the good news is that with this patch the kernel no longer relies on this strnlen_user value for anything beyond recording it in the log we also update it with a trustworthy value whenever possible reported by pengfei wang wpengfeinudt gmail com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by paul moore paul paul moore com

x86 nmi 64 reorder nested nmi check check the repeat_nmi end_repeat_nmi special case first the next patch will rework the rsp check and a a side effect the rsp check will no longer detect repeat_nmi end_repeat_nmi so we ll need this ordering of the check note this is more subtle than it appears the check for repeat_nmi end_repeat_nmi jump straight out of the nmi code instead of adjusting the iret frame to force a repeat this is necessary because the code between repeat_nmi and end_repeat_nmi set nmi executing and then writes to the iret frame itself if a nested nmi come in and modifies the iret frame while repeat_nmi is also modifying it we ll end up with garbage the old code got this right a doe the new code but the new code is a bit more explicit if we were to move the check right after the nmi executing check then we d get it wrong and have random crash because the nmi executing check would jump to the code that would modify the iret frame without checking if the interrupted nmi wa currently modifying it signed off by andy lutomirski luto kernel org reviewed by steven rostedt rostedt goodmis org cc borislav petkov bp suse de cc linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org cc peter zijlstra peterz infradead org cc thomas gleixner tglx linutronix de cc stable vger kernel org signed off by ingo molnar mingo kernel org

ocfs2 should wait dio before inode lock in ocfs2_setattr we should wait dio request to finish before inode lock in ocfs2_setattr otherwise the following deadlock will happen process 1 process 2 process 3 truncate file a end_io of writing file a receiving the bast message ocfs2_setattr ocfs2_inode_lock_tracker ocfs2_inode_lock_full inode_dio_wait __inode_dio_wait waiting for all dio request finish dlm_proxy_ast_handler dlm_do_local_bast ocfs2_blocking_ast ocfs2_generic_handle_bast set ocfs2_lock_blocked flag dio_end_io dio_bio_end_aio dio_complete ocfs2_dio_end_io ocfs2_dio_end_io_write ocfs2_inode_lock __ocfs2_cluster_lock ocfs2_wait_for_mask waiting for ocfs2_lock_blocked flag to be cleared that is waiting for process 1 unlocking the inode lock inode_dio_end here dec the i_dio_count but will never be called so a deadlock happened link http lkml kernel org r 59f81636 70508 huawei com signed off by alex chen alex chen huawei com reviewed by jun piao piaojun huawei com reviewed by joseph qi jiangqi903 gmail com acked by changwei ge ge changwei h3c com cc mark fasheh mfasheh versity com cc joel becker jlbec evilplan org cc junxiao bi junxiao bi oracle com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

pppd eliminate potential integer overflow in option parsing when we are reading in a word from an option file we maintain a count of the length we have seen so far in len which is an int when len exceeds maxwordlen 1 i e 1023 we cease storing character in the buffer but we continue to increment len since len is an int it will wrap around to 2147483648 after it reach 2147483647 at that point our test of len maxwordlen 1 will succeed and we will start writing character to memory again this may enable an attacker to overwrite the heap and thereby corrupt security relevant variable for this reason it ha been assigned a cve identifier cve 2014 3158 this fix the bug by ceasing to increment len once it reach maxwordlen reported by lee campbell leecam google com signed off by paul mackerras paulus samba org

sctp properly timestamp outgoing data chunk for rtx purpose recent change to the retransmit code exposed a long standing bug where it wa possible for a chunk to be time stamped after the retransmit timer wa reset this caused a rare situation where the retrnamist timer ha expired but nothing wa marked for retrnasmission because all of timesamps on data were le then 1 rto ago a result the timer wa never restarted since nothing wa retransmitted and this resulted in a hung association that did couldn t complete the data transfer the solution is to timestamp the chunk when it s added to the packet for transmission purpose after the packet is trsnmitted the rtx timer is restarted this guarantee that when the timer expires there will be data to retransmit signed off by vlad yasevich vladislav yasevich hp com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

sctp fix race on protocol netns initialization consider sctp module is unloaded and is being requested because an user is creating a sctp socket during initialization sctp will add the new protocol type and then initialize pernet subsys status sctp_v4_protosw_init if status goto err_protosw_init status sctp_v6_protosw_init if status goto err_v6_protosw_init status register_pernet_subsys sctp_net_ops the problem is that after those call to sctp_v 4 6 _protosw_init it is possible for userspace to create sctp socket like if the module is already fully loaded if that happens one of the possible effect is that we will have reader for net sctp local_addr_list list earlier than expected and sctp_net_init doe not take precaution while dealing with that list leading to a potential panic but not limited to that a sctp_sock_init will copy a bunch of blank partially initialized value from net sctp the race happens like this cpu 0 cpu 1 socket __sock_create socket inet_create __sock_create list_for_each_entry_rcu answer inetsw sock type list inet_create no hit if unlikely err request_module socket creation is blocked the module is fully loaded sctp_init sctp_v4_protosw_init inet_register_protosw list_add_rcu p list last_perm list_for_each_entry_rcu answer inetsw sock type sctp_v6_protosw_init list hit so assumes protocol is already loaded socket creation continues before netns is initialized register_pernet_subsys simply inverting the initialization order between register_pernet_subsys and sctp_v4_protosw_init is not possible because register_pernet_subsys will create a control sctp socket so the protocol must be already visible by then deferring the socket creation to a work queue is not good specially because we loose the ability to handle it error so a suggested by vlad the fix is to split netns initialization in two moment default and control socket so that the default are already loaded by when we register the protocol while control socket initialization is kept at the same moment it is today fix 4db67e808640 sctp make the address list per network namespace signed off by vlad yasevich vyasevich gmail com signed off by marcelo ricardo leitner marcelo leitner gmail com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

issue 10730 use crypto_api for generating nonce and improve hashing a new crypto api function crypto_generate_uri_safe_nonce ha been added which generates base64 encoded uri safe alphabet nonce according to rfc4648 this nonce creation function can thus be used throughout mantisbt where we need a random nonce the primary use at the moment is with form_api token hashing throughout the codebase ha been improved to use the newly implemented g_crypto_master_salt configuration option this deprecates a number of older salt configuration option a we now derive salt from the master salt a needed the whirlpool hashing function is used to generate stronger hash instead of the original md5 hashing that is now deprecated r key cookie string lost password confirmation hash captcha key form csrf token and so forth have all been upgraded to make use of the new crypto api infrastructure and better hashing salting method

fix writev regression pan hanging unkillable and un straceable frederik himpe reported an unkillable and un straceable pan process zero length iovecs can go into an infinite loop in writev because the iovec iterator doe not always advance over them the sequence required to trigger this is not trivial i think it requires that a zero length iovec be followed by a non zero length iovec which cause a pagefault in the atomic usercopy this cause the writev code to drop back into single segment copy mode which then try to copy the 0 byte of the zero length iovec a zero length copy look like a failure though so it loop put a test into iov_iter_advance to catch zero length iovecs we could just put the test in the fallback path but i feel it is more robust to skip over zero length iovecs throughout the code iovec iterator may be used in filesystems too so it should be robust signed off by nick piggin npiggin suse de signed off by ingo molnar mingo elte hu signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

ignore a project link in bsrequestaction check_action_permission this make sure that we check the permission of the correct package for instance assume that the project staging is a link project where the link point to the base project also assume that there exists a base foo package but there exists no explicit staging foo package moreover assume we check the permission for the following submit action action type submit source project staging package foo target project an_arbitrary_project package foo action in this case the old code check if request acceptor can modify the base foo package since it follows the project link this is wrong because the staging foo package would be turned into a branch during accept the new code check the correct package because it doe not follow the project link and requires that the source package exists in the source project requiring the existence of the source package potentially break artificial request for instance a request where the submit action from above is preceded by a submit action that creates a staging foo package note so far i wa unable to exploit the old code so this is just to avoid a potential future headache fix commit 990ef7ccc api webui check access to source package

iio adc stm32 adc fix a race when using several adcs with dma and irq end of conversion may be handled by using irq or dma there may be a race when two conversion complete at the same time on several adcs eoc can be read a set for several adcs with an adc configured to use irqs eocie bit is set the handler is normally called in this case an adc configured to use dma eocie bit isn t set eoc trigger the dma request instead it s then automatically cleared by dma read but the handler get called due to status bit is temporarily set irq triggered by the other adc so both eoc status bit in csr and eocie control bit must be checked before invoking the interrupt handler e g call isr only for irq enabled adcs fix 2763ea0585c9 iio adc stm32 add optional dma support signed off by fabrice gasnier fabrice gasnier st com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by jonathan cameron jonathan cameron huawei com

alsa control fix replacing user control there are two issue with the current implementation for replacing user control the first is that the code doe not check if the control is actually a user control and neither doe it check if the control is owned by the process that try to remove it that allows userspace application to remove arbitrary control which can cause a user after free if a for example a driver doe not expect a control to be removed from under it feed the second issue is that on one hand when a control is replaced the user_ctl_count limit is not checked and on the other hand the user_ctl_count is increased even though the number of user control doe not change this allows userspace once the user_ctl_count limit a been reached to repeatedly replace a control until user_ctl_count overflow once that happens new control can be added effectively bypassing the user_ctl_count limit both issue can be fixed by instead of open coding the removal of the control that is to be replaced to use snd_ctl_remove_user_ctl this function doe proper permission check a well a decrement user_ctl_count after the control ha been removed note that by using snd_ctl_remove_user_ctl the check which return ebusy at beginning of the function if the control already exists is removed this is not a problem though since the check is quite useless because the lock that is protecting the control list is released between the check and before adding the new control to the list which mean that it is possible that a different control with the same setting is added to the list after the check luckily there is another check that is done while holding the lock in snd_ctl_add so we ll rely on that to make sure that the same control is not added twice signed off by lars peter clausen lars metafoo de acked by jaroslav kysela perex perex cz cc stable vger kernel org signed off by takashi iwai tiwai suse de

uapi libc compat add fallback for unsupported libcs libc compat h aim to prevent symbol collision between uapi and libc header for each supported libc this requires continuous coordination between them the goal of this commit is to improve the situation for libcs such a musl which are not yet supported and or do not wish to be explicitly supported while not affecting supported libcs more precisely with this commit unsupported libcs can request the suppression of any specific uapi definition by defining the correspondings _uapi_def_ macro a 0 this can fix symbol collision for them a long a the libc header are included before the uapi header inclusion in the other order is outside the scope of this commit all infrastructure in order to enable this fallback for unsupported libcs is already in place except that libc compat h unconditionally defines all _uapi_def_ macro to 1 for all unsupported libcs so that any previous definition are ignored in order to fix this this commit merely make these definition conditional this commit together with the musl libc commit http git musl libc org cgit musl commit id 04983f2272382af92eb8f8838964ff944fbb8258 fix for example the following compiler error when linux in6 h is included after musl s netinet in h linux in6 h 32 8 error redefinition of struct in6_addr linux in6 h 49 8 error redefinition of struct sockaddr_in6 linux in6 h 59 8 error redefinition of struct ipv6_mreq the comment referencing glibc are still correct but this file is not only used for glibc any more signed off by felix janda felix janda posteo de reviewed by hauke mehrtens hauke hauke m de signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

userns also map extent in the reverse map to kernel id the current logic first clone the extent array and sort both copy then map the lower id of the forward mapping into the lower namespace but doesn t map the lower id of the reverse mapping this mean that code in a nested user namespace with 5 extent will see incorrect id it also break some access check like inode_owner_or_capable and privileged_wrt_inode_uidgid so a process can incorrectly appear to be capable relative to an inode to fix it we have to make sure that the lower_first member of extent in both array are translated and we have to make sure that the reverse map is sorted after the translation since otherwise the translation can break the sorting this is cve 2018 18955 fix 6397fac4915a userns bump idmap limit to 340 cc stable vger kernel org signed off by jann horn jannh google com tested by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com reviewed by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com signed off by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com

ext4 fix race between page fault and hole punching currently page fault and hole punching are completely unsynchronized this can result in page fault faulting in a page into a range that we are punching after truncate_pagecache_range ha been called and thus we can end up with a page mapped to disk block that will be shortly freed filesystem corruption will shortly follow note that the same race is avoided for truncate by checking page fault offset against i_size but there isn t similar mechanism available for punching hole fix the problem by creating new rw semaphore i_mmap_sem in inode and grab it for writing over truncate hole punching and other function removing block from extent tree and for read over page fault we cannot easily use i_data_sem for this since that rank below transaction start and we need something ranking above it so that it can be held over the whole truncate hole punching operation also remove various workarounds we had in the code to reduce race window when page fault could have created page with stale mapping information signed off by jan kara jack suse com signed off by theodore t o tytso mit edu

fix remember me cookie the security configuration in etc security mh_default_org xml enables a remember me cookie based on a hash created from the username password and an additional system key opencast ha hard coded this system key in the large xml file and never mention to change this basically ensuring that all system use the same key sec remember me key opencast user service ref userdetailsservice this mean that an attacker getting access to a remember me token for one server can get access to all server which allow log in using the same credential without ever needing the credential for example a remember me token obtained from develop opencast org can be used on stable opencast org without actually knowing the log in credential such an attack will usually not work on different installation assuming that safe unique password are used but it is basically guaranteed to work to get access to all machine of one cluster if a token from one machine is compromised this patch now make opencast automatically generate a safe key based on unique system property creating a safe zero configuration variant of the remember me token this patch additionally switch from using md5 for the token to using sha 512 instead to also be more resilient against brute force attack in case an attacker get access to such a token

af_netlink force credential passing cve 2012 3520 pablo neira ayuso discovered that avahi and potentially networkmanager accept spoofed netlink message because of a kernel bug the kernel pass all zero scm_credentials ancillary data to the receiver if the sender did not provide such data instead of not including any such data at all or including the correct data from the peer a it is the case with af_unix this bug wa introduced in commit 16e572626961 af_unix dont send scm_credentials by default this patch force passing credential for netlink a before the regression another fix would be to not add scm_credentials in netlink message if not provided by the sender but it might break some program with help from florian weimer petr matousek this issue is designated a cve 2012 3520 signed off by eric dumazet edumazet google com cc petr matousek pmatouse redhat com cc florian weimer fweimer redhat com cc pablo neira ayuso pablo netfilter org signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

net fix divide by zero in tcp algorithm illinois reading tcp stats when using tcp illinois congestion control algorithm can cause a divide by zero kernel oops the division by zero occur in tcp_illinois_info at do_div t ca cnt_rtt where ca cnt_rtt can become zero when rtt_reset is called step to reproduce 1 register tcp_illinois sysctl w net ipv4 tcp_congestion_control illinois 2 monitor internal tcp information via command s i watch d s i 3 establish new tcp conn to machine either it fails at the initial conn or else it need to wait for a loss or a reset this is only related to reading stats the function avg_delay also performs the same divide but is guarded with a ca cnt_rtt 0 at it calling point in update_params thus simply fix tcp_illinois_info function tcp_illinois_info get_info is called without socket lock thus eliminate any race condition on ca cnt_rtt by using a local stack variable simply reuse info tcpv_rttcnt a it already set to ca cnt_rtt function avg_delay is not affected by this race condition a it called with the socket lock cc petr matousek pmatouse redhat com signed off by jesper dangaard brouer brouer redhat com acked by eric dumazet edumazet google com acked by stephen hemminger shemminger vyatta com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

nfsd check for oversized nfsv2 v3 argument a client can append random data to the end of an nfsv2 or nfsv3 rpc call without our complaining we ll just stop parsing at the end of the expected data and ignore the rest encoded argument and reply are stored together in an array of page and if a call is too large it could leave inadequate space for the reply this is normally ok because nfs rpc s typically have either short argument and long reply like read or long argument and short reply like write but a client that sends an incorrectly long reply can violate those assumption this wa observed to cause crash also several operation increment rq_next_page in the decode routine before checking the argument size which can leave rq_next_page pointing well past the end of the page array causing trouble later in svc_free_pages so following a suggestion from neil brown add a central check to enforce our expectation that no nfsv2 v3 call ha both a large call and a large reply a followup we may also want to rewrite the encoding routine to check more carefully that they aren t running off the end of the page array we may also consider rejecting call that have any extra garbage appended that would be safer and within our right by spec but given the age of our server and the nfs protocol and the fact that we ve never enforced this before we may need to balance that against the possibility of breaking some oddball client reported by tuomas haanpää thaan synopsys com reported by ari kauppi ari synopsys com cc stable vger kernel org reviewed by neilbrown neilb suse com signed off by j bruce field bfields redhat com

dcache handle escaped path in prepend_path a rename can result in a dentry that by walking up d_parent will never reach it s mnt_root for lack of a better term i call this an escaped path prepend_path is called by four different function __d_path d_absolute_path d_path and getcwd __d_path only want to see path are connected to the root it pass in so __d_path need prepend_path to return an error d_absolute_path similarly want to see path that are connected to some root escaped path are not connected to any mnt_root so d_absolute_path need prepend_path to return an error greater than 1 so escaped path will be treated like path on lazily unmounted mount getcwd need to prepend unreachable so getcwd also need prepend_path to return an error d_path is the interesting hold out d_path just want to print something and doe not care about the weird case which raise the question what should be printed given that escaped_path anything should result in enoent i believe it is desirable for escaped path to be printed a empty path a there are not really any meaninful path component when considered from the perspective of a mount tree so tweak prepend_path to return an empty path with an new error code of 3 when it encounter an escaped path signed off by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com signed off by al viro viro zeniv linux org uk

btrfs fix truncation of compressed and inlined extent when truncating a file to a smaller size which consists of an inline extent that is compressed we did not discard or made unusable the data between the new file size and the old file size wasting metadata space and allowing for the truncated data to be leaked and the data corruption loss mentioned below we were also not correctly decrementing the number of byte used by the inode we were setting it to zero giving a wrong report for caller of the stat 2 syscall the fsck tool also reported an error about a mismatch between the nbytes of the file versus the real space used by the file now because we weren t discarding the truncated region of the file it wa possible for a caller of the clone ioctl to actually read the data that wa truncated allowing for a security breach without requiring root access to the system using only standard filesystem operation the scenario is the following 1 user a creates a file which consists of an inline and compressed extent with a size of 2000 byte the file is not accessible to any other user no read write or execution permission for anyone else 2 the user truncates the file to a size of 1000 byte 3 user a make the file world readable 4 user b creates a file consisting of an inline extent of 2000 byte 5 user b issue a clone operation from user a s file into it own file using a length argument of 0 clone the whole range 6 user b now get to see the 1000 byte that user a truncated from it file before it made it file world readbale user b also lost the byte in the range 1000 2000 byte from it own file but that might be ok if his her intention wa reading stale data from user a that wa never supposed to be public note that this contrast with the case where we truncate a file from 2000 byte to 1000 byte and then truncate it back from 1000 to 2000 byte in this case reading any byte from the range 1000 2000 will return a value of 0x00 instead of the original data this problem exists since the clone ioctl wa added and happens both with and without my recent data loss and file corruption fix for the clone ioctl patch btrfs fix file corruption and data loss after cloning inline extent so fix this by truncating the compressed inline extent a we do for the non compressed case which involves decompressing if the data isn t already in the page cache compressing the truncated version of the extent writing the compressed content into the inline extent and then truncate it the following test case for fstests reproduces the problem in order for the test to pas both this fix and my previous fix for the clone ioctl that forbids cloning a smaller inline extent into a larger one which is titled btrfs fix file corruption and data loss after cloning inline extent are needed without that other fix the test fails in a different way that doe not leak the truncated data instead part of destination file get replaced with zero because the destination file ha a larger inline extent than the source seq basename 0 seqres result_dir seq echo qa output created by seq tmp tmp status 1 failure is the default trap _cleanup exit status 0 1 2 3 15 _cleanup rm f tmp get standard environment filter and check common rc common filter real qa test start here _need_to_be_root _supported_fs btrfs _supported_os linux _require_scratch _require_cloner rm f seqres full _scratch_mkfs seqres full 2 1 _scratch_mount o compress create our test file file foo is going to be the source of a clone operation and consists of a single inline extent with an uncompressed size of 512 byte while file bar consists of a single inline extent with an uncompressed size of 256 byte for our test s purpose it s important that file bar ha an inline extent with a size smaller than foo s inline extent xfs_io_prog f c pwrite s 0xa1 0 128 c pwrite s 0x2a 128 384 scratch_mnt foo _filter_xfs_io xfs_io_prog f c pwrite s 0xbb 0 256 scratch_mnt bar _filter_xfs_io now durably persist all metadata and data we do this to make sure that we get on disk an inline extent with a size of 512 byte for file foo sync now truncate our file foo to a smaller size because it consists of a compressed and inline extent btrfs did not shrink the inline extent to the new size if the extent wa not compressed btrfs would shrink it to 128 byte it only update the inode s i_size to 128 byte xfs_io_prog c truncate 128 scratch_mnt foo now clone foo s inline extent into bar this clone operation should fail with errno eopnotsupp because the source file consists only of an inline extent and the file s size is smaller than the inline extent of the destination 128 byte 256 byte however the clone ioctl wa not prepared to deal with a file that ha a size smaller than the size of it inline extent something that happens only for compressed inline extent resulting in copying the full inline extent from the source file into the destination file note that btrfs clone operation for inline extent consists of removing the inline extent from the destination inode and copy the inline extent from the source inode into the destination inode meaning that if the destination inode s inline extent is larger n byte than the source inode s inline extent m byte some byte n m byte will be lost from the destination file btrfs could copy the source inline extent s data into the destination s inline extent so that we would not lose any data but that s currently not done due to the complexity that would be needed to deal with such case specially when one or both extent are compressed returning eopnotsupp a it s normally not a very common case to clone very small file only case where we get inline extent and copying inline extent doe not save any space unlike for normal non inlined extent cloner_prog s 0 d 0 l 0 scratch_mnt foo scratch_mnt bar now because the above clone operation used to succeed and due to foo s inline extent not being shinked by the truncate operation our file bar got the whole inline extent copied from foo making u lose the last 128 byte from bar which got replaced by the byte in range 128 256 from foo before foo wa truncated in other word data loss from bar and being able to read old and stale data from foo that should not be possible to read anymore through normal filesystem operation contrast with the case where we truncate a file from a size n to a smaller size m truncate it back to size n and then read the range m n we should always get the value 0x00 for all the byte in that range we expected the clone operation to fail with errno eopnotsupp and therefore not modify our file s bar data metadata so it content should be 256 byte long with all byte having the value 0xbb without the btrfs bug fix the clone operation succeeded and resulted in leaking truncated data from foo the byte that belonged to it range 128 256 and losing data from bar in that same range so reading the file gave u the following content 0000000 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 a1 0000200 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 2a 0000400 echo file bar s content after the clone operation od t x1 scratch_mnt bar also because the foo s inline extent wa not shrunk by the truncate operation btrfs fsck which is run by the fstests framework everytime a test completes failed reporting the following error root 5 inode 257 error 400 nbytes wrong status 0 exit cc stable vger btrfs fix double range unlock of hole region when reading page if when reading a page we find a hole and our caller had already locked the range bio flag ha the bit extent_bio_parent_locked set we end up unlocking the hole s range and then later our caller unlocks it again which might have already been locked by some other task once the first unlock happened currently this can only happen during a call to the extent_same ioctl a it s the only caller of __do_readpage that set the bit extent_bio_parent_locked for bio flag fix this by leaving the unlock exclusively to the caller signed off by filipe manana fdmanana suse com

ptrace ensure arch_ptrace ptrace_request can never race with sigkill putreg assumes that the tracee is not running and pt_regs_access can safely play with it stack however a killed tracee can return from ptrace_stop to the low level asm code and do restore_rest this mean that debugger can actually read modify the kernel stack until the tracee doe save_rest again set_task_blockstep can race with sigkill too and in some sense this race is even worse the very fact the tracee can be woken up break the logic a linus suggested we can clear task_wakekill around the arch_ptrace call this ensures that nobody can ever wakeup the tracee while the debugger look at it not only this fix the mentioned problem we can do some cleanup simplification in arch_ptrace path probably ptrace_unfreeze_traced need more caller for example it make sense to make the tracee killable for oom killer before access_process_vm while at it add the comment into may_ptrace_stop to explain why ptrace_stop still can t rely on sigkill and signal_pending_state reported by salman qazi sqazi google com reported by suleiman souhlal suleiman google com suggested by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org signed off by oleg nesterov oleg redhat com signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

net sctp fix ipv6 ipsec encryption bug in sctp_v6_xmit alan chester reported an issue with ipv6 on sctp that ipsec traffic is not being encrypted whereas on ipv4 it is setting up an ah esp transport doe not seem to have the desired effect sctp ipv4 22 14 20 809645 ip tos 0x2 ect 0 ttl 64 id 0 offset 0 flag df proto ah 51 length 116 192 168 0 2 192 168 0 5 ah spi 0x00000042 sumlen 16 seq 0x1 esp spi 0x00000044 seq 0x1 length 72 22 14 20 813270 ip tos 0x2 ect 0 ttl 64 id 0 offset 0 flag df proto ah 51 length 340 192 168 0 5 192 168 0 2 ah spi 0x00000043 sumlen 16 seq 0x1 sctp ipv6 22 31 19 215029 ip6 class 0x02 hlim 64 next header sctp 132 payload length 364 fe80 222 15ff fe87 7fc 3333 fe80 92e6 baff fe0d 5a54 36767 sctp 1 init ack init tag 747759530 rwnd 62464 o 10 mi 10 moreover alan say this problem wa seen with both racoon and racoon2 other people have seen this with openswan when ipsec is configured to encrypt all upper layer protocol the sctp connection doe not initialize after using wireshark to follow packet this is because the sctp packet leaf box a unencrypted and box b belief all upper layer protocol are to be encrypted so it drop this packet causing the sctp connection to fail to initialize when ipsec is configured to encrypt just sctp the sctp packet are observed unencrypted in fact using socat sctp6 listen 3333 on one end and transferring plaintext string on the other end result in cleartext on the wire where sctp eventually doe not report any error thus in the latter case that alan report the non paranoid user might think he s communicating over an encrypted transport on sctp although he s not tcpdump x 0x0030 5d70 8e1a 0003 001a 177d eb6c 0000 0000 p l 0x0040 0000 0000 706c 6169 6e74 6578 740a 0000 plaintext only in proc net xfrm_stat we can see xfrmintmplmismatch increasing on the receiver side initial follow up analysis from alan s bug report wa done by alexey dobriyan also thanks to vlad yasevich for feedback on this sctp ha it own implementation of sctp_v6_xmit not calling inet6_csk_xmit this ha the implication that it probably never really got updated along with change in inet6_csk_xmit and therefore doe not seem to invoke xfrm handler sctp s ipv4 xmit however properly call ip_queue_xmit to do the work since a call to inet6_csk_xmit would solve this problem but result in unecessary route lookup let u just use the cached flowi6 instead that we got through sctp_v6_get_dst since all sctp packet are being sent through sctp_packet_transmit we do the route lookup flow caching in sctp_transport_route hold it in tp dst and skb_dst_set right after that if we would alter fl6 daddr in sctp_v6_xmit to np opt srcrt we possibly could run into the same effect of not having xfrm layer pick it up hence use fl6_update_dst in sctp_v6_get_dst instead to get the correct source routed dst entry which we assign to the skb also source address routing example from 625034113 sctp fix sctp to work with ipv6 source address routing still work with this patch nevertheless in rfc5095 it is actually recommended to not use that anyway due to traffic amplification 1 so it seems we re not supposed to do that anyway in sctp_v6_xmit moreover if we overwrite the flow destination here the lower ipv6 layer will be unable to put the correct destination address into ip header a routing header is added in ipv6_push_nfrag_opts but then probably with wrong final destination thing aside result of this patch is that we do not have any xfrmintmplmismatch increase plus on the wire with this patch it now look like sctp ipv6 08 17 47 074080 ip6 2620 52 0 102f 7a2b cbff fe27 1b0a 2620 52 0 102f 213 72ff fe32 7eba ah spi 0x00005fb4 seq 0x1 esp spi 0x00005fb5 seq 0x1 length 72 08 17 47 074264 ip6 2620 52 0 102f 213 72ff fe32 7eba 2620 52 0 102f 7a2b cbff fe27 1b0a ah spi 0x00003d54 seq 0x1 esp spi 0x00003d55 seq 0x1 length 296 this fix kernel bugzilla 24412 this security issue seems to be present since 2 6 18 kernel let just hope some big passive adversary in the wild didn t have it fun with that lksctp tool ipv6 regression test suite pass a well with this patch 1 http www secdev org conf ipv6_rh_security csw07 pdf exec do not leave bprm interp on stack if a series of script are executed each triggering module loading via unprintable byte in the script header kernel stack content can leak into the command line normally execution of binfmt_script and binfmt_misc happens recursively however when module are enabled and unprintable byte exist in the bprm buf execution will restart after attempting to load matching binfmt module unfortunately the logic in binfmt_script and binfmt_misc doe not expect to get restarted they leave bprm interp pointing to their local stack this mean on restart bprm interp is left pointing into unused stack memory which can then be copied into the userspace argv area after additional study it seems that both recursion and restart remains the desirable way to handle exec with script misc and module a such we need to protect the change to interp this change the logic to require allocation for any change to the bprm interp to avoid adding a new kmalloc to every exec the default value is left a is only when passing through binfmt_script or binfmt_misc doe an allocation take place for a proof of concept see dotest sh from http www halfdog net security 2012 linuxkernelbinfmtscriptstackdatadisclosure signed off by kees cook keescook chromium org cc halfdog me halfdog net cc p j p ppandit redhat com cc alexander viro viro zeniv linux org uk cc stable vger kernel org signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

fix null deref in spnego acceptor cve 2014 4344 when processing a continuation token acc_ctx_cont wa dereferencing the initial byte of the token without checking the length this could result in a null dereference cve 2014 4344 in mit krb5 1 5 and newer an unauthenticated or partially authenticated remote attacker can cause a null dereference and application crash during a spnego negotiation by sending an empty token a the second or later context token from initiator to acceptor the attacker must provide at least one valid context token in the security context negotiation before sending the empty token this can be done by an unauthenticated attacker by forcing spnego to renegotiate the underlying mechanism or by using iakerb to wrap an unauthenticated a req a the first token cvssv2 vector av n ac l au n c n i n a c e poc rl of rc c kaduk mit edu cve summary cvssv2 vector ticket 7970 new subject null dereference in spnego acceptor for continuation token cve 2014 4344 target_version 1 12 2 tag pullup

xfs more robust inode extent count validation when the inode is in extent format it can t have more extent that fit in the inode fork we don t currenty check this and so this corruption go unnoticed by the inode verifier this can lead to crash operating on invalid in memory structure attempt to access such a inode will now error out in the verifier rather than allowing modification operation to proceed reported by wen xu wen xu gatech edu signed off by dave chinner dchinner redhat com reviewed by darrick j wong darrick wong oracle com darrick fix a typedef add some brace and break to shut up compiler warning signed off by darrick j wong darrick wong oracle com

inotify fix double free corruption of stuct user on an error path in inotify_init1 a normal user can trigger a double free of struct user this is a regression introduced by a2ae4cc9a16e inotify stop kernel memory leak on file creation failure we fix this by making sure that if a group exists the user reference is dropped when the group is cleaned up we should not explictly drop the reference on error and also drop the reference when the group is cleaned up the new lifetime rule are that an inotify group life from inotify_new_group to the last fsnotify_put_group since the struct user and inotify_devs are directly tied to this lifetime they are only changed updated in those two location we get rid of all special casing of struct user or user inotify_devs signed off by eric paris eparis redhat com cc stable kernel org 2 6 37 and up signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

ext4 fix undefined behavior in ext4_fill_flex_info commit 503358ae01b70ce6909d19dd01287093f6b6271c ext4 avoid divide by zero when trying to mount a corrupted file system fix cve 2009 4307 by performing a sanity check on s_log_groups_per_flex since it can be set to a bogus value by an attacker sbi s_log_groups_per_flex sbi s_es s_log_groups_per_flex groups_per_flex 1 sbi s_log_groups_per_flex if groups_per_flex 2 this patch fix two potential issue in the previous commit 1 the sanity check might only work on architecture like powerpc on x86 5 bit are used for the shifting amount that mean given a large s_log_groups_per_flex value like 36 groups_per_flex 1 36 is essentially 1 4 16 rather than 0 this will bypass the check leaving s_log_groups_per_flex and groups_per_flex inconsistent 2 the sanity check relies on undefined behavior i e oversized shift a standard confirming c compiler could rewrite the check in unexpected way consider the following equivalent form assuming groups_per_flex is unsigned for simplicity groups_per_flex 1 sbi s_log_groups_per_flex if groups_per_flex 0 groups_per_flex 1 we compile the code snippet using clang 3 0 and gcc 4 6 clang will completely optimize away the check groups_per_flex 0 leaving the patched code a vulnerable a the original gcc keep the check but there is no guarantee that future version will do the same signed off by xi wang xi wang gmail com signed off by theodore t o tytso mit edu cc stable vger kernel org

key fix race with concurrent install_user_keyrings this fix cve 2013 1792 there is a race in install_user_keyrings that can cause a null pointer dereference when called concurrently for the same user if the uid and uid session keyrings are not yet created it might be possible for an unprivileged user to trigger this by calling keyctl from userspace in parallel immediately after logging in assume that we have two thread both executing lookup_user_key both looking for key_spec_user_session_keyring thread a thread b call install_user_keyrings if cred user session_keyring call install_user_keyrings user uid_keyring uid_keyring if user uid_keyring return 0 key cred user session_keyring null user session_keyring session_keyring atomic_inc key usage oops at the point thread a dereferences cred user session_keyring thread b hasn t updated user session_keyring yet but thread a assumes it is populated because install_user_keyrings returned ok the race window is really small but can be exploited if for example thread b is interrupted or preempted after initializing uid_keyring but before doing setting session_keyring this couldn t be reproduced on a stock kernel however after placing systemtap probe on user session_keyring session_keyring that introduced some delay the kernel could be crashed reliably fix this by checking both pointer before deciding whether to return alternatively the test could be done away with entirely a it is checked inside the mutex but since the mutex is global that may not be the best way signed off by david howells dhowells redhat com reported by mateusz guzik mguzik redhat com cc stable kernel org signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by james morris james l morris oracle com

fix handling of parameter entity reference there were two bug where parameter entity reference could lead to an unexpected change of the input buffer in xmlparsenamecomplex and xmldictlookup being called with an invalid pointer percent sign in dtd name the nextl macro used to call xmlparserhandlepereference when parsing complex name inside the dtd this could result in entity expansion which created a new input buffer the fix is to simply remove the call to xmlparserhandlepereference from the nextl macro this is safe because no user of the macro require expansion of parameter entity xmlparsenamecomplex xmlparsencnamecomplex xmlparsenmtoken the percent sign is not allowed in name which are grammatical token xmlparseentityvalue parameter entity reference in entity value are expanded but this happens in a separate step in this function xmlparsesystemliteral parameter entity reference are ignored in the system literal xmlparseattvaluecomplex xmlparsechardatacomplex xmlparsecommentcomplex xmlparsepi xmlparsecdsect parameter entity reference are ignored outside the dtd xmlloadentitycontent this function is only called from xmlstringlendecodeentities and entity are replaced in a separate step immediately after the function call this bug could also be triggered with an internal subset and double entity expansion this fix bug 766956 initially reported by wei lei and independently by chromium s clusterfuzz hanno böck and marco grassi thanks to everyone involved xmlparsenamecomplex with xml_parse_old10 when parsing name inside an expanded parameter entity with the xml_parse_old10 option xmlparsenamecomplex would call xmlgrow via the grow macro if the input buffer wa exhausted at the end of the parameter entity s replacement text this function would then call xmlpopinput which invalidated the input buffer there should be no need to invoke grow in this situation because the buffer is grown periodically every xml_parser_chunk_size character and at least for utf 8 in xmlcurrentchar this also match the code path executed when xml_parse_old10 is not set this fix bug 781205 cve 2017 9049 and 781361 cve 2017 9050 thanks to marcel böhme and thuan pham for the report additional hardening a separate check wa added in xmlparsenamecomplex to validate the buffer size

mm fadvise c drain all pagevecs if posix_fadv_dontneed fails to discard all page rob van der heij reported the following paraphrased on private mail the scenario is that i want to avoid backup to fill up the page cache and purge stuff that is more likely to be used again this is with s390x linux on z vm so i don t give it a much memory that we don t care anymore so i have something with ld_preload that intercept the close call from tar in this case and issue a posix_fadvise just before closing the file this mostly work except for small file le than 14 page that remains in page cache after the face unfortunately rob ha not had a chance to test this exact patch but the test program below should be reproducing the problem he described the issue is the per cpu pagevecs for lru addition if the page are added by one cpu but fadvise is called on another then the page remain resident a the invalidate_mapping_pages only drain the local pagevecs via it call to pagevec_release the user visible effect is that a program that us fadvise properly is not obeyed a possible fix for this is to put the necessary smart into invalidate_mapping_pages to globally drain the lru pagevecs if a pagevec page could not be discarded the downside with this is that an inode cache shrink would send a global ipi and memory pressure potentially causing global ipi storm is very undesirable instead this patch add a check during fadvise posix_fadv_dontneed to check if invalidate_mapping_pages discarded all the requested page if a subset of page are discarded it drain the lru pagevecs and try again if the second attempt fails it assumes it is due to the page being mapped locked or dirty and doe not care with this patch an application using fadvise correctly will be obeyed but there is a downside that a malicious application can force the kernel to send global ipis and increase overhead if accepted i would like this to be considered a a stable candidate it s not an urgent issue but it s a system call that is not working a advertised which is weak the following test program demonstrates the problem it should never report that page are still resident but will without this patch it assumes that cpu 0 and 1 exist int main int fd int pagesize getpagesize ssize_t written 0 expected char buf unsigned char vec int resident i cpu_set_t set prepare a buffer for writing expected filesize_pages pagesize buf malloc expected 1 if buf null printf enomem n exit exit_failure buf expected 0 memset buf a expected prepare the mincore vec vec malloc filesize_pages if vec null printf enomem n exit exit_failure tcp make challenge acks le predictable yue cao claim that current host rate limiting of challenge acks rfc 5961 could leak enough information to allow a patient attacker to hijack tcp session he will soon provide detail in an academic paper this patch increase the default limit from 100 to 1000 and add some randomization so that the attacker can no longer hijack session without spending a considerable amount of probe based on initial analysis and patch from linus note that we also have per socket rate limiting so it is tempting to remove the host limit in the future v2 randomize the count of challenge acks per second not the period fix 282f23c6ee34 tcp implement rfc 5961 3 2 reported by yue cao ycao009 ucr edu signed off by eric dumazet edumazet google com suggested by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org cc yuchung cheng ycheng google com cc neal cardwell ncardwell google com acked by neal cardwell ncardwell google com acked by yuchung cheng ycheng google com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

svc initialize tmp_va_buf to prevent a toctou attack tmp_va_buf will be used if caller parameter point to private ta memory however after doing the syscall to invoke the command it could be that ree ha changed caller parameter to point to regular shared memory and that could potentially open for tmp_va_buf leaking old information on the stack mitigate this by simplify tee_svc_update_out_param by only taking tmp_buf_va n into account to tell if a temporary buffer is used or not note that tee_svc_copy_to_user will make sure that only data writeable by the user ta can be updated fix double fetch can be used to copy from uninitialized pointer a reported by riscure signed off by jens wiklander jens wiklander linaro org tested by joakim bech joakim bech linaro org qemu v7 v8 reviewed by joakim bech joakim bech linaro org reported by riscure inforequest riscure com reported by alyssa milburn a a milburn vu nl acked by etienne carriere etienne carriere linaro org

mm thp give transparent hugepage code a separate copy_page right now the migration code in migrate_page_copy us copy_huge_page for hugetlbfs and thp page if pagehuge page pagetranshuge page copy_huge_page newpage page so yay for code reuse but void copy_huge_page struct page dst struct page src struct hstate h page_hstate src and a non hugetlbfs page ha no page_hstate this work 99 of the time because page_hstate determines the hstate from the page order alone since the page order of a thp page match the default hugetlbfs page order it work but if you change the default huge page size on the boot command line say default_hugepagesz 1g then we might not even have a 2mb hstate so page_hstate return null and copy_huge_page oopses pretty fast since copy_huge_page dereferences the hstate void copy_huge_page struct page dst struct page src struct hstate h page_hstate src if unlikely pages_per_huge_page h max_order_nr_pages mel noticed that the migration code is really the only user of these function this move all the copy code over to migrate c and make copy_huge_page work for thp by checking for it explicitly i believe the bug wa introduced in commit b32967ff101a mm numa add thp migration for the numa working set scanning fault case akpm linux foundation org fix coding style and comment text per naoya horiguchi signed off by dave hansen dave hansen linux intel com acked by mel gorman mgorman suse de reviewed by naoya horiguchi n horiguchi ah jp nec com cc hillf danton dhillf gmail com cc andrea arcangeli aarcange redhat com tested by dave jiang dave jiang intel com signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

limit character allowed in id opencast allows almost arbitrary identifier for medium package and element to be used this can be problematic for operation and security since such identifier are sometimes used for file system operation which may lead to attacker being able to escape working directory and write file to other location in addition opencast s id tostring v id compact behavior the latter trying to mitigate some of the file system problem can cause error due to identifier mismatch since an identifier may unintentionally change this patch limit the character allowed to be used in identifier to ensure no unsafe operation are possible and no mismatch may happen

sctp fix sk_ack_backlog wrap around problem consider the scenario for a tcp style socket while processing the cookie_echo chunk in sctp_sf_do_5_1d_ce after it ha passed a series of sanity check a new association would be created in sctp_unpack_cookie but afterwards some processing maybe failed and sctp_association_free will be called to free the previously allocated association in sctp_association_free sk_ack_backlog value is decremented for this socket since the initial value for sk_ack_backlog is 0 after the decrement it will be 65535 a wrap around problem happens and if we want to establish new association afterward in the same socket abort would be triggered since sctp deem the accept queue a full fix this issue by only decrementing sk_ack_backlog for association in the endpoint s list fix suggested by neil horman nhorman tuxdriver com signed off by xufeng zhang xufeng zhang windriver com acked by daniel borkmann dborkman redhat com acked by vlad yasevich vyasevich gmail com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

libceph introduce ceph_crypt for in place en decryption starting with 4 9 kernel stack may be vmalloced and therefore not guaranteed to be physically contiguous the new config_vmap_stack option is enabled by default on x86 this make it invalid to use on stack buffer with the crypto scatterlist api a sg_set_buf expects a logical address and won t work with vmalloced address there isn t a different e g kvec based crypto api we could switch net ceph crypto c to and the current scatterlist h api isn t getting updated to accommodate this use case allocating a new header and padding for each operation is a non starter so do the en decryption in place on a single pre assembled header data padding heap buffer this is explicitly supported by the crypto api the caller may provide the same scatter gather list for the plaintext and cipher text after the completion of the cipher operation the plaintext data is replaced with the ciphertext data in case of an encryption and vice versa for a decryption signed off by ilya dryomov idryomov gmail com reviewed by sage weil sage redhat com

batman adv calculate extra tail size based on queued fragment the fragmentation code wa replaced in 610bfc6bc99bc83680d190ebc69359a05fc7f605 batman adv receive fragmented packet and merge the new code provided a mostly unused parameter skb for the merging function it is used inside the function to calculate the additionally needed skb tailroom but instead of increasing it own tailroom it is only increasing the tailroom of the first queued skb this is not correct in some situation because the first queued entry can be a different one than the parameter an observed problem wa 1 packet with size 104 total_size 1464 fragno 1 wa received packet is queued 2 packet with size 1400 total_size 1464 fragno 0 wa received packet is queued at the end of the list 3 enough data wa received and can be given to the merge function 1464 1400 20 104 20 merge function get 1400 byte large packet a skb argument 4 merge function get first entry in queue 104 byte stored a skb_out 5 merge function calculates the required extra tail a total_size skb len pskb_expand_head tail of skb_out with 64 byte 6 merge function try to squeeze the extra 1380 byte from the second queued skb 1400 byte aka skb parameter in the 64 extra tail byte of skb_out instead calculate the extra required tail byte for skb_out also using skb_out instead of using the parameter skb the skb parameter is only used to get the total_size from the last received packet this is also the total_size used to decide that all fragment were received reported by philipp psurek philipp psurek gmail com signed off by sven eckelmann sven narfation org acked by martin hundebøll martin hundeboll net signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

mnt don t propagate unmounts to locked mount if the first mount in shared subtree is locked don t unmount the shared subtree this is ensured by walking through the mount parent before child and marking a mount a unmountable if it is not locked or it is locked but it s parent is marked this allows recursive mount detach to propagate through a set of mount when unmounting them would not reveal what is under any locked mount cc stable vger kernel org signed off by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com

bpf fix branch offset adjustment on backjumps after patching ctx expansion when ctx access is used the kernel often need to expand rewrite instruction so after that patching branch offset have to be adjusted for both forward and backward jump in the new ebpf program but for backward jump it fails to account the delta meaning for example if the expansion happens exactly on the insn that sits at the jump target it doesn t fix up the back jump offset analysis on what the check in adjust_branches is currently doing adjust offset of jmps if necessary if i po i insn off 1 po insn off delta else if i po i insn off 1 po insn off delta first condition forward jump before after insns 0 insns 0 insns 1 i insn insns 1 i insn insns 2 po insns p po insns 3 insns p delta insns 4 target_x insns p insns 5 insns 3 insns 4 target_x insns 5 first case is if we cross po boundary and the jump instruction wa before po this is handeled correctly i e if i po then this would mean our jump that we currently check wa the patchlet itself that we just injected since such patchlets are self contained and have no awareness of any insns before or after the patched one the delta is correctly not adjusted also for the second condition in case of i insn off 1 po mean we jump to that newly patched instruction so no offset adjustment are needed that part is correct second condition backward jump before after insns 0 insns 0 insns 1 target_x insns 1 target_x insns 2 po target_y insns p po target_y insns 3 insns p delta insns 4 i insn insns p insns 5 insns 3 insns 4 i insn insns 5 second interesting case is where we cross po boundary and the jump instruction wa after po backward jump with i po would be impossible and pose a bug somewhere in the patchlet so the first condition checking i po is okay only by itself however i insn off 1 po doe not always work a intended to trigger the adjustment it work when jump target would be far off where the delta wouldn t matter but for example where the fixed insn off before pointed to po target_y it now point to po delta so that additional room need to be taken into account for the check this mean that i both test here need to be adjusted into po delta and ii for the second condition the test need to be a po itself can be a target in the backjump too fix 9bac3d6d548e bpf allow extended bpf program access skb field signed off by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

prevent access to repos which are in the process of bring migrated björn kautler pointed out that when a repo is being migrated into gitolite a per the documentation 1 there is a gap between the actual move of the repo and the rest of the process where a user can gain read or write access to the repo which he would not have had after the completion of the process my first thought wa to document this and advise people to use the writable command to disable writes but there is nothing a simple and painless to prevent read on the plus side this kind of racy read access can only happen if the conf is using the deny rule option to restrict read without that it make no difference i e he get no access that he would not have got later anyway but eventually i realised that documentation wa frustrating for various reason and that at least in this case there is a way to fix it in the code just block all access to a repo that is in repository but which doe not yet have the update hook setup correctly plus the code doe not impact anything else and is basically just an extra check 1 http gitolite com gitolite basic admin index html appendix 1 bringing existing repos into gitolite
