fix acccess_ok on alpha and sh commit 594cc251fdd0 make user_access_begin do access_ok broke both alpha and sh booting in qemu a noticed by guenter roeck it turn out that the bug wasn t actually in that commit itself which would have been surprising it wa mostly a no op but in how the addition of access_ok to the strncpy_from_user and strnlen_user function now triggered the case where those function would test the access of the very last byte of the user address space the string function actually did that user range test before too but they did it manually by just comparing against user_addr_max but with user_access_begin doing the check using access_ok it now exposed problem in the architecture implementation of that function for example on alpha the access_ok helper macro looked like this define __access_ok addr size get_fs seg addr size addr size 0 and what it basically test is of any of the high bit get set the user_ds masking value is 0xfffffc0000000000 and that s completely wrong for the addr size check because it s off by one for the case where we check to the very end of the user address space which is exactly what the strn _user function do why because addr size will be exactly the size of the address space so trying to access the last byte of the user address space will fail the __access_ok check even though it shouldn t a a result the user string accessor function failed consistently because they literally don t know how long the string is going to be and the max access is going to be that last byte of the user address space side note that alpha macro is buggy for another reason too it re us the argument twice and sh ha another version of almost the exact same bug define __addr_ok addr unsigned long __force addr current_thread_info addr_limit seg so far so good yes a user address must be below the limit but then define __access_ok addr size __addr_ok addr size is wrong with the exact same off by one case the case when addr size is exactly _equal_ to the limit is actually perfectly fine think one byte access at the last address of the user address space the sh version is actually seriously buggy in another way it doesn t actually check for overflow even though it did copy the _comment_ that talk about overflow so it turn out that both sh and alpha actually have completely buggy implementation of access_ok but they happened to work in practice although the sh overflow one is a serious serious security bug not that anybody likely care about sh security this fix the problem by using a similar macro on both alpha and sh it isn t trying to be clever the end address is based on this logic unsigned long __ao_end __ao_a __ao_b __ao_b which basically say add start and length and then subtract one unless the length wa zero we can t subtract one for a zero length or we d just hit an underflow instead for a lot of access_ok user the length is a constant so this isn t actually a expensive a it initially look reported and tested by guenter roeck linux roeck u net cc matt turner mattst88 gmail com cc yoshinori sato ysato user sourceforge jp signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

remove div_long_long_rem x86 is the only arch right now which provides an optimized for div_long_long_rem and it ha the downside that one ha to be very careful that the divide doesn t overflow the api is a little akward a the argument for the unsigned divide are signed the signed version also doesn t handle a negative divisor and produce worse code on 64bit arch there is little incentive to keep this api alive so this convert the few user to the new api signed off by roman zippel zippel linux m68k org cc ralf baechle ralf linux mips org cc ingo molnar mingo elte hu cc thomas gleixner tglx linutronix de cc john stultz johnstul u ibm com cc christoph lameter clameter sgi com signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

replace md5 with bcrypt for password hashing user password are stored in the database using the rather outdated and cryptographically insecure md5 hash algorithm furthermore the hash are salted using the username instead of a random salt causing hash for user with the same username and password to collide which is problematic especially for popular user like the default admin user this essentially mean that for an attacker it might be feasible to reconstruct a user s password given access to these hash note that attacker needing access to the hash mean that they must gain access to the database in which these are stored first to be able to start cracking the password patch the patch make opencast now us the modern and much stronger bcrypt password hashing algorithm for storing password note that old hash remain md5 until the password is updated for a list of user whose password hash are stored using md5 the rest endpoint user utils user md5 json is added

alsa timer fix incorrectly assigned timer instance the clean up commit 41672c0c24a6 alsa timer simplify error path in snd_timer_open unified the error handling code path with the standard goto but it introduced a subtle bug the timer instance is stored in snd_timer_open incorrectly even if it return an error this may eventually lead to uaf a spotted by fuzzer the culprit is the snd_timer_open code check the sndrv_timer_iflg_exclusive flag with the common variable timeri this variable is supposed to be the newly created instance but we ab used it for a temporary check before the actual creation of a timer instance after that point there is another check for the max number of instance and it bail out if over the threshold before the refactoring above it worked fine because the code returned directly from that point after the refactoring however it jump to the unified error path that store the timeri variable in return even if it return an error unfortunately this stored value is kept in the caller side snd_timer_user_tselect in tu timeri this cause inconsistency later a if the timer wa successfully assigned in this patch we fix it by not re using timeri variable but a temporary variable for testing the exclusive connection so timeri remains null at that point fix 41672c0c24a6 alsa timer simplify error path in snd_timer_open reported and tested by tristan madani tristmd gmail com cc stable vger kernel org link http lore kernel org r 20191106165547 23518 1 tiwai suse de signed off by takashi iwai tiwai suse de

coredump fix race condition between mmget_not_zero get_task_mm and core dumping the core dumping code ha always run without holding the mmap_sem for writing despite that is the only way to ensure that the entire vma layout will not change from under it only using some signal serialization on the process belonging to the mm is not nearly enough this wa pointed out earlier for example in hugh s post from jul 2017 http lkml kernel org r alpine lsu 2 11 1707191716030 2055 eggly anvil not strictly relevant here but a related note i wa very surprised to discover only quite recently how handle_mm_fault may be called without down_read mmap_sem when core dumping that seems a misguided optimization to me which would also be nice to correct in particular because the growsdown and growsup can move the vm_start vm_end the various loop the core dump doe around the vma will not be consistent if page fault can happen concurrently pretty much all user calling mmget_not_zero get_task_mm and then taking the mmap_sem had the potential to introduce unexpected side effect in the core dumping code adding mmap_sem for writing around the core_dump invocation is a viable long term fix but it requires removing all copy user and page fault and to replace them with get_dump_page for all binary format which is not suitable a a short term fix for the time being this solution manually cover the place that can confuse the core dump either by altering the vma layout or the vma flag while it run once core_dump run under mmap_sem for writing the function mmget_still_valid can be dropped allowing mmap_sem protected section to run in parallel with the coredump provides some minor parallelism advantage to the swapoff code which seems to be safe enough by never mangling any vma field and can keep doing swapins in parallel to the core dumping and to some other corner case in order to facilitate the backporting i added fix 86039bd3b4e6 however the side effect of this same race condition in proc pid mem should be reproducible since before 2 6 12 rc2 so i couldn t add any other fix because there s no hash beyond the git genesis commit because find_extend_vma is the only location outside of the process context that could modify the mm structure under mmap_sem for reading by adding the mmget_still_valid check to it all other case that take the mmap_sem for reading don t need the new check after mmget_not_zero get_task_mm the expand_stack in page fault context also doesn t need the new check because all task under core dumping are frozen link http lkml kernel org r 20190325224949 11068 mm memory_hotplug do not back off draining pcp free page from kworker context drain_all_pages back off when called from a kworker context since commit 0ccce3b92421 mm page_alloc drain per cpu page from workqueue context because the original ipi based pcp draining ha been replaced by a wq based one and the check wanted to prevent from recursion and inter worker dependency this ha made some sense at the time because the system wq ha been used and one worker holding the lock could be blocked while waiting for new worker to emerge which can be a problem under oom condition since then commit ce612879ddc7 mm move pcp and lru pcp draining into single wq ha moved draining to a dedicated mm_percpu_wq wq with a rescuer so we shouldn t depend on any other wq activity to make a forward progress so calling drain_all_pages from a worker context is safe a long a this doesn t happen from mm_percpu_wq itself which is not the case because all worker are required to _not_ depend on any mm lock why is this a problem in the first place acpi driven memory hot remove acpi_device_hotplug is executed from the worker context we end up calling __offline_pages to free all the page and that requires both lru_add_drain_all_cpuslocked and drain_all_pages to do their job otherwise we can have dangling page on pcp list and fail the offline operation __test_page_isolated_in_pageblock would see a page with 0 ref count but without pagebuddy set fix the issue by removing the worker check in drain_all_pages lru_add_drain_all_cpuslocked doesn t have this restriction so it work a expected link http lkml kernel org r 20170828093341 26341 1 mhocko kernel org fix 0ccce3b924212 mm page_alloc drain per cpu page from workqueue context signed off by michal hocko mhocko suse com cc mel gorman mgorman suse de cc tejun heo tj kernel org cc stable vger kernel org 4 11 signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

n_tty fix n_tty_write crash when echoing in raw mode the tty atomic_write_lock doe not provide an exclusion guarantee for the tty driver if the termios setting are lecho opost and since it is unexpected and not allowed to call tty buffer helper like tty_insert_flip_string concurrently this may lead to crash when concurrect writer call pty_write in that case the following two writer the echoing from a workqueue and pty_write from the process race and can overflow the corresponding tty buffer like follows if we look into tty_insert_flip_string_fixed_flag there is int space __tty_buffer_request_room port goal flag struct tty_buffer tb port buf tail memcpy char_buf_ptr tb tb used char space tb used space so the race of the two can result in something like this a b __tty_buffer_request_room __tty_buffer_request_room memcpy buf tb used tb used space memcpy buf tb used boom b s memcpy is past the tty_buffer due to the previous a s tb used increment since the n_tty line discipline input processing can output concurrently with a tty write obtain the n_tty ldisc output_lock to serialize echo output with normal tty writes this ensures the tty buffer helper tty_insert_flip_string is not called concurrently and everything is fine note that this is nicely reproducible by an ordinary user using forkpty and some setup around that raw termios echo and it is present in kernel at least after commit d945cb9cce20ac7143c2de8d88b187f62db99bdc pty rework the pty layer to use the normal buffering logic in 2 6 31 rc3 j add more info to the commit log j switch to bool j lock unconditionally j lock only the tty ops write call reference cve 2014 0196 reported and tested by jiri slaby jslaby suse cz signed off by peter hurley peter hurleysoftware com signed off by jiri slaby jslaby suse cz cc linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org cc alan cox alan lxorguk ukuu org uk cc stable vger kernel org signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh linuxfoundation org

issue 553 fix broken decryption for zip file sometimes decompressing wa failing due to miscalculation of buffer offset and hence causing a silent buffer overflow when a previous chunk decompression left some byte in the decryption buffer it wa not taken into account in determining space left in the decompression buffer so it could happen that the decryption buffer is completely full but some byte are not used yet in such case even though the buffer is full the code tried to decrypt more byte behind it s boundary this cl resolve this issue by properly calculating the amount of space left in the decompression buffer this is an edited version of tomasz mikolajewski s pull request

fix spnego context aliasing bug cve 2015 2695 the spnego mechanism currently replaces it context handle with the mechanism context handle upon establishment under the assumption that most g function are only called after context establishment this assumption is incorrect and can lead to aliasing violation for some program maintain the spnego context structure after context establishment and refer to it in all g method add initiate and opened flag to the spnego context structure for use in gss_inquire_context prior to context establishment cve 2015 2695 in mit krb5 1 5 and later application which call gss_inquire_context on a partially established spnego context can cause the g api library to read from a pointer using the wrong type generally causing a process crash this bug may go unnoticed because the most common spnego authentication scenario establishes the context after just one call to gss_accept_sec_context java server application using the native jgss provider are vulnerable to this bug a carefully crafted spnego packet might allow the gss_inquire_context call to succeed with attacker determined result but application should not make access control decision based on gss_inquire_context result prior to context establishment cvssv2 vector av n ac m au n c n i n a c e poc rl of rc c ghudson mit edu several bugfixes style change and edge case behavior change commit message and cve description ticket 8244 target_version 1 14 tag pullup

crypto aesni fix memory usage in gcm decryption the kernel crypto api logic requires the caller to provide the length of ciphertext authentication tag a cryptlen for the aead decryption operation thus the cipher implementation must calculate the size of the plaintext output itself and cannot simply use cryptlen the rfc4106 gcm decryption operation try to overwrite cryptlen memory in req dst a the destination buffer for decryption only need to hold the plaintext memory but cryptlen reference the input buffer holding ciphertext authentication tag the assumption of the destination buffer length in rfc4106 gcm operation lead to a too large size this patch simply us the already calculated plaintext size in addition this patch fix the offset calculation of the aad buffer pointer a mentioned before cryptlen already includes the size of the tag thus the tag doe not need to be added with the addition the aad will be written beyond the already allocated buffer note this fix a kernel crash that can be triggered from user space via af_alg aead simply use the libkcapi test application from 1 and update it to use rfc4106 gcm aes using 1 the change were tested using cavs vector to demonstrate that the crypto operation still delivers the right result 1 http www chronox de libkcapi html cc tadeusz struk tadeusz struk intel com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by stephan mueller smueller chronox de signed off by herbert xu herbert gondor apana org au

polkit when authorizing via pk let s re resolve callback userdata instead of caching it previously when doing an async pk query we d store the original callback userdata pair and call it again after the pk request is complete this is problematic since pk query might be slow and in the meantime the userdata might be released and re acquired let s avoid this by always traversing through the message handler so that we always re resolve the callback and userdata pair and thus can be sure it s up to date and properly valid

vfs rename check backing inode being equal if a file is renamed to a hardlink of itself posix specifies that rename 2 should do nothing and return success this condition is checked in vfs_rename however it won t detect hard link on overlayfs where these are given separate inodes on the overlayfs layer overlayfs itself detects this condition and return success without doing anything but then vfs_rename will proceed a if this wa a successful rename detach_mounts d_move the correct thing to do is to detect this condition before even calling into overlayfs this patch doe this by calling vfs_select_inode to get the underlying inodes signed off by miklos szeredi mszeredi redhat com cc stable vger kernel org v4 2

key sort out big_key initialisation big_key ha two separate initialisation function one that register the key type and one that register the crypto if the key type fails to register there s no problem if the crypto register successfully because there s no way to reach the crypto except through the key type however if the key type register successfully but the crypto doe not big_key_rng and big_key_blkcipher may end up set to null but the code neither check for this nor unregisters the big key key type furthermore since the key type is registered before the crypto it is theoretically possible for the kernel to try adding a big_key before the crypto is set up leading to the same effect fix this by merging big_key_crypto_init and big_key_init and calling the resulting function late if they re going to be encrypted we shouldn t be creating big_keys before we have the facility to do the encryption available the key type registration is also moved after the crypto initialisation the fix also includes message printing on failure if the big_key type isn t correctly set up simply doing dd if dev zero b 4096 count 1 keyctl padd big_key a s ought to cause an oops fix 13100a72f40f5748a04017e0ab3df4cf27c809ef security key big key stored encrypted signed off by david howells dhowells redhat com cc peter hlavaty zer0mem yahoo com cc kirill marinushkin k marinushkin gmail com cc artem savkov asavkov redhat com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by james morris james l morris oracle com

nbd server handle modern style negotiation in a child process previously the modern style negotiation wa carried out in the root server listener process before forking the actual client handler this made it possible for a malfunctioning or evil client to terminate the root process simply by querying a non existent export or aborting in the middle of the negotation process caused sigpipe in the server this commit move the negotiation process to the child to keep the root process up and running no matter what happens during the negotiation see http sourceforge net mailarchive message php msg_id 30410146 signed off by tuomas räsänen tuomasjjrasanen tjjr fi

alsa control fix replacing user control there are two issue with the current implementation for replacing user control the first is that the code doe not check if the control is actually a user control and neither doe it check if the control is owned by the process that try to remove it that allows userspace application to remove arbitrary control which can cause a user after free if a for example a driver doe not expect a control to be removed from under it feed the second issue is that on one hand when a control is replaced the user_ctl_count limit is not checked and on the other hand the user_ctl_count is increased even though the number of user control doe not change this allows userspace once the user_ctl_count limit a been reached to repeatedly replace a control until user_ctl_count overflow once that happens new control can be added effectively bypassing the user_ctl_count limit both issue can be fixed by instead of open coding the removal of the control that is to be replaced to use snd_ctl_remove_user_ctl this function doe proper permission check a well a decrement user_ctl_count after the control ha been removed note that by using snd_ctl_remove_user_ctl the check which return ebusy at beginning of the function if the control already exists is removed this is not a problem though since the check is quite useless because the lock that is protecting the control list is released between the check and before adding the new control to the list which mean that it is possible that a different control with the same setting is added to the list after the check luckily there is another check that is done while holding the lock in snd_ctl_add so we ll rely on that to make sure that the same control is not added twice signed off by lars peter clausen lars metafoo de acked by jaroslav kysela perex perex cz cc stable vger kernel org signed off by takashi iwai tiwai suse de

cve 2015 1335 protect container mount against symlinks when a container start up lxc set up the container s inital fstree by doing a bunch of mounting guided by the container configuration file the container config is owned by the admin or user on the host so we do not try to guard against bad entry however since the mount target is in the container it s possible that the container admin could divert the mount with symbolic link this could bypass proper container startup i e confinement of a root owned container by the restrictive apparmor policy by diverting the required write to proc self attr current or bypass the path based apparmor policy by diverting say proc to mnt in the container to prevent this 1 do not allow mount to path containing symbolic link 2 do not allow bind mount from relative path containing symbolic link detail define safe_mount which ensures that the container ha not inserted any symbolic link into any mount target for mount to be done during container setup the host s mount path may contain symbolic link a it is under the control of the administrator that s ok so safe_mount begin the check for symbolic link after the rootfs mount by opening that directory it open each directory along the path using openat relative to the parent directory using o_nofollow when the target is reached it mount onto proc self fd targetfd use safe_mount in mount_entry when mounting container proc and when needed in particular safe_mount need not be used in any case where 1 the mount is done in the container s namespace 2 the mount is for the container s rootfs 3 the mount is relative to a tmpfs or proc sysfs which we have just safe_mount ed ourselves since we were using proc net a a temporary placeholder for proc sys net during container startup and proc net is a symbolic link use proc tty instead update the lxc container conf manpage with detail about the new restriction finally add a testcase to test some symbolic link possibility reported by roman fiedler tmpfs fix use after free of mempolicy object the tmpfs remount logic preserve filesystem mempolicy if the mpol m option is not specified in the remount request a new policy can be specified if mpol m is given before this patch remounting an mpol bound tmpfs without specifying mpol mount option in the remount request would set the filesystem s mempolicy object to a freed mempolicy object to reproduce the problem boot a debug_pagealloc kernel and run mkdir tmp x mount t tmpfs o size 100m mpol interleave nodev tmp x grep tmp x proc mount nodev tmp x tmpfs rw relatime size 102400k mpol interleave 0 3 0 0 mount o remount size 200m nodev tmp x grep tmp x proc mount nodev tmp x tmpfs rw relatime size 204800k mpol 0 0 note garbage in mpol output above dd if dev zero of tmp x f count 1 panic here panic bug unable to handle kernel null pointer dereference at null ip null null oops 0010 1 smp debug_pagealloc call trace mpol_shared_policy_init 0xa5 0x160 shmem_get_inode 0x209 0x270 shmem_mknod 0x3e 0xf0 shmem_create 0x18 0x20 vfs_create 0xb5 0x130 do_last 0x9a1 0xea0 path_openat 0xb3 0x4d0 do_filp_open 0x42 0xa0 do_sys_open 0xfe 0x1e0 compat_sys_open 0x1b 0x20 cstar_dispatch 0x7 0x1f non debug kernel will not crash immediately because referencing the dangling mpol will not cause a fault instead the filesystem will reference a freed mempolicy object which will cause unpredictable behavior the problem boil down to a dropped mpol reference below if shmem_parse_options doe not allocate a new mpol config sbinfo shmem_parse_options data config true mpol_put sbinfo mpol sbinfo mpol config mpol bug save unreferenced mpol this patch avoids the crash by not releasing the mempolicy if shmem_parse_options doesn t create a new mpol how far back doe this issue go i see ipv4 fix a race in ip4_datagram_release_cb alexey gave a addresssanitizer 1 report that finally gave a good hint at where wa the origin of various problem already reported by dormando in the past 2 problem come from the fact that udp can have a lockless tx path and concurrent thread can manipulate sk_dst_cache while another thread is holding socket lock and call __sk_dst_set in ip4_datagram_release_cb this wa added in linux 3 8 it seems that all we need to do is to use sk_dst_check and sk_dst_set so that all the writer hold same spinlock sk sk_dst_lock to prevent corruption tcp stack do not need this protection a all sk_dst_cache writer hold the socket lock 1 http code google com p address sanitizer wiki addresssanitizerforkernel addresssanitizer heap use after free in userns don t allow creation if the user is chrooted guarantee that the policy of which file may be access that is established by setting the root directory will not be violated by user namespaces by verifying that the root directory point to the root of the mount namespace at the time of user namespace creation changing the root is a privileged operation and a a matter of policy it serf to limit unprivileged process to file below the current root directory for reason of simplicity and comprehensibility the privilege to change the root directory is gated solely on the cap_sys_chroot capability in the user namespace therefore when creating a user namespace we must ensure that the policy of which file may be access can not be violated by changing the root directory anyone who run a process in a chroot and would like to use user namespace can setup the same view of filesystems with a mount namespace instead with this result that this is not a practical limitation for using user namespaces cc stable vger kernel org acked by serge hallyn serge hallyn canonical com reported by andy lutomirski luto amacapital net signed off by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com

verification with an asymmetric key of a token signed with a symmetric key there is a vulnerability in this module when the verification part is expecting a token digitally signed with an asymetric key r e family of algorithm but instead the attacker send a token digitally signed with a symmetric algorithm h family the issue is because this library ha the very same signature to verify both type of token parameter secretorpublickey this change add a new parameter to the verify called algorithm this can be used to specify a list of supported algorithm but the default value depends on the secret used if the secretorpublickey contains the string begin certificate the default is rs256 rs384 rs512 es256 es384 es512 otherwise is hs256 hs384 hs512

cve 2017 15112 unsafe use of p admin password on command line it is unsafe to pas a password a part of the command line args because it appears in the process info and is recorded in the shell command history the p keycloak admin password arg ha been replaced with p keycloak admin password file which read the password from a file or stdin if given a hyphen the now deprecated keycloak admin password also accepted stdin with a hyphen this wa retained for backward compatibility during a transition period it will issue a deprecation warning trying to use keycloak admin password with anything other than a hyphen will result in an error and explanation the man page wa updated to include a section on password passing and includes documention on using the keycloak_admin_password environment variable which wa always supported but never documented the admin password command line arg in keycloak_cli py wa also updated in a similar manner and now also includes support for keycloak_admin_password environment variable

v4l dvb 6690 saa7134 fix ignored interrupt the saa7134 video driver start dropping frame when used together with the saa7134 alsa driver frame are dropped because when an audio event is waiting the driver simply ignores the interrupt and pass it on to the saa7134 alsa interrupt handler the alsa interrupt handler in turn acknowledges all type of event thus clearing the pending video event a well fix by only masking out the audio event in the video interrupt handler and by only acknowledging the audio event in the alsa driver signed off by heikki lindholm holindho c helsinki fi signed off by mauro carvalho chehab mchehab infradead org

sctp fix another socket race during accept peeloff there is a race between sctp_rcv and sctp_accept where we have moved the association from the listening socket to the accepted socket but sctp_rcv processing cached the old socket and continues to use it the easy solution is to check for the socket mismatch once we ve grabed the socket lock if we hit a mi match that mean that were are currently holding the lock on the listening socket but the association is refrencing a newly accepted socket we need to drop the lock on the old socket and grab the lock on the new one a more proper solution might be to create accepted socket when the new association is established similar to tcp that would eliminate the race for 1 to 1 style socket but it would still existing for 1 to many socket where a user wished to peeloff an association for now we ll live with this easy solution a it address the problem reported by michal hocko mhocko suse cz reported by karsten keil kkeil suse de signed off by vlad yasevich vladislav yasevich hp com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

tighten up security for rsync nick cleaton nick cleaton net found and reported a security issue caused by trusting the remote rsync too much it appears that rsync cannot without special precaution be used in any restricted environment gitolite ship with a bundle helper called rsync disabled by default more detail below this fix tightens up this helper to close this hole tldr for administrator and packagers 1 am i affected look in gitolite rc for rsync if it is there you are affected this is not an essential program and it is not enabled by default you or a previous administrator of your site would have to have explicitly enabled it for you to be affected 2 what s the quick fix comment out the rsync line in gitolite rc immediately do not leave it enabled if you are unable to upgrade immediately uncomment it only after you have upgraded or patched 3 that bad huh sadly yes detail this program is not a core program despite the name it will not function a a generic rsync this is only meant to help out people who are on flaky connection trying to clone a large repo because git clone is not resumable one common technique is to have someone create a bundle then download the bundle to seed the local repo then git fetch to finish off since the bundle is a single file you can use resumable mechanism like rsync to download it what this command doe is allow that kind of bundling to happen automatically if an administrator enables it the user simply rsyncs a bundle file using his gitolite credential a a result the rsync helper command that ship with gitolite is executed this program manages the creation and expiry of bundle file then pass control to the real rsync program to perform the actual data transfer it is this last step that requires special care when used in a restricted environment resulting in the need for this patch

restrict pixelbuffer dimension to safe value we do a lot of calculation based on pixel coordinate and we need to make sure they do not overflow restrict the maximum dimension we support rather than try to switch over all calculation to use 64 bit integer this prevents attacker from from injecting code by specifying a huge framebuffer size and relying on the value overflowing to access invalid area of the heap this primarily affect the client which get both the screen dimension and the pixel content from the remote side but the server might also be affected a a client can adjust the screen dimension a can application inside the session issue found by pavel cheremushkin from kaspersky lab

fix x with data html link and form action the academically correct way to filter out xlink hrefs should have been to use hasattributens getattributens with the xlink namespace but from my testing browser don t care about that namespace at all and only use the xlink prefix this mean that even if you correctly specify a different prefix for the xlink n the link won t be detected by the browser xlink prefix otoh even work without specifying the xlink namespace in the xml document reported by liuzhu fantasy7082 hotmail com

fix ldap misused policy name crash cve 2014 5353 in krb5_ldap_get_password_policy_from_dn if ldap_search return successfully with no result return krb5_kdb_noentry instead of returning success with a zeroed out policy object this fix a null dereference when an admin attempt to use an ldap ticket policy name a a password policy name cve 2014 5353 in mit krb5 when kadmind is configured to use ldap for the kdc database an authenticated remote attacker can cause a null dereference by attempting to use a named ticket policy object a a password policy for a principal the attacker need to be authenticated a a user who ha the elevated privilege for setting password policy by adding or modifying principal query to ldap scoped to the krbpwdpolicy object class will correctly not return entry of other class such a ticket policy object but may return success with no returned element if an object with the requested dn exists in a different object class in this case the routine to retrieve a password policy returned success with a password policy object that consisted entirely of zeroed memory in particular access to the policy name will dereference a null pointer kdc operation doe not access the policy name field but most kadmin operation involving the principal with incorrect password policy will trigger the crash thanks to patrik ki for reporting this problem cvssv2 vector av n ac m au s c n i n a c e h rl of rc c kaduk mit edu cve description and cv score ticket 8051 new target_version 1 13 1 tag pullup

prevent crlf injection described in cve 2019 12387 author markrwilliams reviewer glyph fix ticket 9647 twisted s http client apis were vulnerable to maliciously constructed http method host and or path uri component such a path and query parameter these vulnerability were beyond the header name and value injection vulnerability addressed in http twistedmatrix com trac ticket 9420 http github com twisted twisted pull 999 the following client apis will raise a valueerror if given a method host or uri that includes newlines or other disallowed character twisted web client agent request twisted web client proxyagent request twisted web client request __init__ twisted web client request writeto proxyagent is patched separately from agent because unlike other agent e g cookieagent it is not implemented a an agent wrapper request __init__ check it method and uri so that error occur closer to their originating input request method and request uri are both public apis however so request writeto via request _writeheaders also check the validity of both before writing anything to the wire additionally the following deprecated client apis have also been patched twisted web client httppagegetter __init__ twisted web client httppagedownloader __init__ twisted web client httpclientfactory __init__ twisted web client httpclientfactory seturl twisted web client httpdownloader __init__ twisted web client httpdownloader seturl twisted web client getpage twisted web client downloadpage these have been patched prior to their removal so that they won t be vulnerable in the last twisted release that includes them they represent a best effort because testing every combination of these public apis would require more code than deprecated apis warrant in all case uri component including hostnames are restricted to the character allowed in path component this mirror the cpython patch for bpo 30458 that address equivalent vulnerability http github com python cpython commit bb8071a4cae5ab3fe321481dd3d73662ffb26052 http method however are checked against the set of character described in rfc 7230

dma helper rewrite completion cancellation this fix various problem with completion cancellation if the io_func fails to get an aiocb the callback wasn t called if dma encounter a bounce buffer conflict and the dma operation is canceled before the bottom half fire bad thing happen memory is not unmapped after cancellation again causing problem when doing dma to i o area cancellation could leak the iovec the callback wa missed if the i o operation failed without returning an aiocb and probably more that i ve missed the patch fix them by sharing the cleanup code between completion and cancellation the dma_bdrv_cb now return a boolean completed not completed flag and the wrapper dma_continue take care of task to do upon completion most of these are basically impossible in practice but it is better to be tidy signed off by paolo bonzini pbonzini redhat com signed off by kevin wolf kwolf redhat com

n_tty fix extproc v icanon interaction with tiocinq aka fionread we added support for extproc back in 2010 in commit 26df6d13406d tty add extproc support for linemode and the intent wa to allow it to override some all icanon behavior quoting from that original commit message there is a new bit in the termios local flag word extproc when this bit is set several aspect of the terminal driver are disabled input line editing character echo and mapping of signal are all disabled this allows the telnetd to turn off these function when in linemode but still keep track of what state the user want the terminal to be in but the problem turn out that several aspect of the terminal driver are disabled is a bit ambiguous and you can really confuse the n_tty layer by setting extproc and then causing some of the icanon invariant to no longer be maintained this fix at least one such case tiocinq becoming unhappy because of the confusion over whether icanon really mean icanon when extproc is set this basically make tiocinq match the case of read if extproc is set we ignore icanon also make sure to reset the icanon state ie extproc change not just if icanon change fix 26df6d13406d tty add extproc support for linemode reported by tetsuo handa penguin kernel i love sakura ne jp reported by syzkaller syzkaller googlegroups com cc jiri slaby jslaby suse com signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh linuxfoundation org

scsi libsas check the ata device status by ata_dev_enabled when ata device identify failed the ata device status is ata_dev_unknown the libata reported like 113518 620433 ata5 00 qc timeout cmd 0xec 113518 653646 ata5 00 failed to identify i o error err_mask 0x4 but libsas verifies the device status by ata_dev_disabled which skipped ata_dev_unknown this will make libsas think the ata device probing succeed the device cannot be actually brought up and even the new bcast of this device will be considered a flutter and will not probe this device again change ata_dev_disabled to ata_dev_enabled so that libsas can deal with this if the ata device probe failed new bcasts can let u try to probe the device again and bring it up if it is fine to identify tested by zhou yupeng zhouyupeng1 huawei com signed off by jason yan yanaijie huawei com cc john garry john garry huawei com cc johannes thumshirn jthumshirn suse de cc ewan milne emilne redhat com cc christoph hellwig hch lst de cc tomas henzl thenzl redhat com cc dan williams dan j williams intel com cc hannes reinecke hare suse com reviewed by john garry john garry huawei com reviewed by hannes reinecke hare suse com reviewed by johannes thumshirn jthumshirn suse de reviewed by christoph hellwig hch lst de signed off by martin k petersen martin petersen oracle com

fix libmodplug c api limit the length of string copied to the output buffer of modplug_instrumentname and modplug_samplename to 32 byte including terminating null a is done by original libmodplug this avoids potential buffer overflow in software relying on this limit instead of querying the required buffer size beforehand libopenmpt can return string longer than 32 byte here beacuse the internal limit of 32 byte applies to string encoded in arbitrary character encoding but the api return them converted to utf 8 which can be longer reported by antonio morale maldonado of semmle security research team git svn id http source openmpt org svn openmpt trunk openmpt 12127 56274372 70c3 4bfc bfc3 4c3a0b034d27

fs_pin allow for the possibility that m_list or s_list go unused this is needed to support lazily umounting locked mount because the entire unmounted subtree need to stay together until there are no user with reference to any part of the subtree to support this guarantee that the fs_pin m_list and s_list node are initialized by initializing them in init_fs_pin allowing for the possibility that pin_insert_group doe not touch them further use hlist_del_init in pin_remove so that there is a hlist_unhashed test before the list we attempt to update the previous list item signed off by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com

mm oom normalize oom score to oom_score_adj scale only for userspace the oom_score_adj scale range from 1000 to 1000 and represents the proportion of memory available to the process at allocation time this mean an oom_score_adj value of 300 for example will bias a process a though it wa using an extra 30 0 of available memory and a value of 350 will discount 35 0 of available memory from it usage the oom killer badness heuristic also us this scale to report the oom score for each eligible process in determining the best process to kill thus it can only differentiate each process s memory usage by 0 1 of system ram on large system this can end up being a large amount of memory 256mb on 256gb system for example this can be fixed by having the badness heuristic to use the actual memory usage in scoring thread and then normalizing it to the oom_score_adj scale for userspace this result in better comparison between eligible thread for kill and no change from the userspace perspective suggested by kosaki motohiro kosaki motohiro jp fujitsu com tested by dave jones davej redhat com signed off by david rientjes rientjes google com signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

crypto algif_aead fix aead tag memory handling for encryption the aead cipher require aad pt a input and generate aad ct tag a output and vice versa for decryption prior to this patch the af_alg interface for aead cipher requires the buffer to be present a input for encryption similarly the output buffer for decryption required the presence of the tag buffer too this implies that the kernel read writes data buffer from to kernel space even though this operation is not required this patch change the af_alg aead interface to be consistent with the in kernel aead cipher requirement due to this handling he change are transparent to user space with one exception the return code of recv indicates the mount of output buffer that output buffer ha a different size compared to before the patch which implies that the return code of recv will also be different for example a decryption operation us 16 byte aad 16 byte ct and 16 byte tag the af_alg aead interface before showed a recv return code of 48 byte whereas after this patch the return code is 32 since the tag is not returned any more reported by mat martineau mathew j martineau linux intel com signed off by stephan mueller smueller chronox de signed off by herbert xu herbert gondor apana org au

ipv6 udp packet following an ufo enqueued packet need also be handled by ufo in the following scenario the socket is corked if the first udp packet is larger then the mtu we try to append it to the write queue via ip6_ufo_append_data a following packet which is smaller than the mtu would be appended to the already queued up gso skb via plain ip6_append_data this cause random memory corruption in ip6_ufo_append_data we also have to be careful to not queue up the same skb multiple time so setup the gso frame only when no first skb is available this also fix a shortcoming where we add the current packet s length to cork length but return early because of a packet mtu with dontfrag set instead of sutracting it again found with trinity cc yoshifuji hideaki yoshfuji linux ipv6 org signed off by hannes frederic sowa hannes stressinduktion org reported by dmitry vyukov dvyukov google com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

bplist disallow key node with non string node type a reported in 86 the binary plist parser would force the type of the key node to be of type plist_key while the node might be of a different i e non string type a following plist_free might then call free on an invalid pointer e g if the node is of type integer it value would be considered a pointer and free would cause an error we prevent this issue by disallowing non string key node during parsing

xfs prevent creating negative sized file via insert_range during the insert range fallocate operation i_size grows by the specified len byte xfs verifies that i_size len s_maxbytes a it should but this comparison is done using the signed loff_t and i_size len can wrap around to a negative value causing the check to incorrectly pas resulting in an inode with negative i_size this is possible on 64 bit platform where xfs set s_maxbytes llong_max ext4 and f2fs don t run into this because they set a smaller s_maxbytes fix it by using subtraction instead reproducer xfs_io f file c truncate 1 63 1 c finsert 0 4096 fix a904b1ca5751 xfs add support falloc_fl_insert_range for fallocate cc stable vger kernel org v4 1 originally from eric biggers ebiggers google com signed off by eric biggers ebiggers google com reviewed by christoph hellwig hch lst de reviewed by darrick j wong darrick wong oracle com darrick fix signed integer addition overflow too signed off by darrick j wong darrick wong oracle com

return only new key in randkey cve 2014 5351 in kadmind s randkey operation if a client specifies the keepold flag do not include the preserved old key in the response cve 2014 5351 an authenticated remote attacker can retrieve the current key for a service principal when generating a new set of key for that principal the attacker need to be authenticated a a user who ha the elevated privilege for randomizing the key of other principal normally when a kerberos administrator randomizes the key of a service principal kadmind return only the new key this prevents an administrator who lack legitimate privileged access to a service from forging ticket to authenticate to that service if the keepold flag to the kadmin randkey rpc operation is true kadmind retains the old key in the kdc database a intended but also unexpectedly return the old key to the client which expose the service to ticket forgery attack from the administrator a mitigating factor is that legitimate client of the affected service will start failing to authenticate to the service once they begin to receive service ticket encrypted in the new key the affected service will be unable to decrypt the newly issued ticket possibly alerting the legitimate administrator of the affected service cvssv2 av n ac h au s c p i n a n e poc rl of rc c tlyu mit edu cve description and cv score ticket 8018 new target_version 1 13 tag pullup

arm 7735 2 preserve the user r w register tpidrurw on context switch and fork since commit 6a1c53124aa1 the user writeable tl register wa zeroed to prevent it from being used a a covert channel between two task there are more and more application coming to window rt wine could support them but mostly they expect to have the thread environment block teb in tpidrurw this patch preserve that register per thread instead of clearing it unlike the tpidruro which is already switched the tpidrurw can be updated from userspace so need careful treatment in the case that we modify tpidrurw and call fork to avoid this we must always read tpidrurw in copy_thread signed off by andré hentschel nerv dawncrow de signed off by will deacon will deacon arm com signed off by jonathan austin jonathan austin arm com signed off by russell king rmk kernel arm linux org uk

btrfs make xattr replace operation atomic replacing a xattr consists of doing a lookup for it existing value delete the current value from the respective leaf release the search path and then finally insert the new value this leaf a time window where reader getxattr listxattrs won t see any value for the xattr xattrs are used to store acls so this ha security implication this change also fix 2 other existing issue which were deleting the old xattr value without verifying first if the new xattr will fit in the existing leaf item in case multiple xattrs are packed in the same item due to name hash collision returning eexist when the flag xattr_create is given and the xattr doesn t exist but we have have an existing item that pack muliple xattrs with the same name hash a the input xattr in this case we should return enospc a test case for xfstests follows soon thanks to alexandre oliva for reporting the non atomicity of the xattr replace implementation reported by alexandre oliva oliva gnu org signed off by filipe manana fdmanana suse com signed off by chris mason clm fb com

usb misc legousbtower fix null pointer deference this patch fix a null pointer dereference caused by a race codition in the probe function of the legousbtower driver it re structure the probe function to only register the interface after successfully reading the board s firmware id the probe function doe not deregister the usb interface after an error receiving the device firmware id the device file registered dev usb legousbtower d may be read written globally before the probe function return when tower_delete is called in the probe function after an r w ha been initiated core dev structure are deleted while the file operation function are still running if the 0 address is mappable on the machine this vulnerability can be used to create a local priviege escalation exploit via a write what where condition by remapping dev interrupt_out_buffer in tower_write a forged usb device and local program execution would be required for lpe the usb device would have to delay the control message in tower_probe and accept the control urb in tower_open whilst guest code initiated a write to the device file a tower_delete is called from the error in tower_probe this bug ha existed since 2003 patch tested by emulated device reported by james patrick evans james jmp e com tested by james patrick evans james jmp e com signed off by james patrick evans james jmp e com cc stable stable vger kernel org signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh linuxfoundation org

mm try_to_unmap_cluster should lock_page before mlocking a bug_on pagelocked wa triggered in mlock_vma_page by sasha levin fuzzing with trinity the call site try_to_unmap_cluster doe not lock the page other than it check_page parameter which is already locked the bug_on in mlock_vma_page is not documented and it purpose is somewhat unclear but apparently it serializes against page migration which could otherwise fail to transfer the pg_mlocked flag this would not be fatal a the page would be eventually encountered again but nr_mlock accounting would become distorted nevertheless this patch add a comment to the bug_on in mlock_vma_page and munlock_vma_page to that effect the call site try_to_unmap_cluster is fixed so that for page check_page trylock_page is attempted to avoid possible deadlock a we already have check_page locked and mlock_vma_page is performed only upon success if the page lock cannot be obtained the page is left without pg_mlocked which is again not a problem in the whole unevictable memory design signed off by vlastimil babka vbabka suse cz signed off by bob liu bob liu oracle com reported by sasha levin sasha levin oracle com cc wanpeng li liwanp linux vnet ibm com cc michel lespinasse walken google com cc kosaki motohiro kosaki motohiro jp fujitsu com acked by rik van riel riel redhat com cc david rientjes rientjes google com cc mel gorman mgorman suse de cc hugh dickins hughd google com cc joonsoo kim iamjoonsoo kim lge com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

merge branch ov tunnel mtu david wragg say set a large mtu on ov created tunnel device prior to 4 3 openvswitch tunnel vports vxlan gre and geneve could transmit vxlan packet of any size constrained only by the ability to send out the resulting packet 4 3 introduced netdevs corresponding to tunnel vports these netdevs have an mtu which limit the size of a packet that can be successfully encapsulated the default mtu value are low 1500 or le which is awkwardly small in the context of physical network supporting jumbo frame and lead to a conspicuous change in behaviour for userspace this patch series set the mtu on openvswitch created netdevs to be the relevant maximum i e the maximum ip packet size minus any relevant overhead effectively restoring the behaviour prior to 4 3 where relevant the limit on mtu value that can be directly set on the netdevs are also relaxed change in v2 extend to all openvswitch tunnel type i e gre and geneve a well use ip_max_mtu change in v3 fix block comment style signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

kvm ppc book3s hv save restore tm state in h_cede it turn out that if the guest doe a h_cede while the cpu is in a transactional state and the h_cede doe a nap and the nap loses the architected state of the cpu which is is allowed to do then we lose the checkpointed state of the virtual cpu in addition the transactional memory state recorded in the msr get reset back to non transactional and when we try to return to the guest we take a tm bad thing type of program interrupt because we are trying to transition from non transactional to transactional with a hrfid instruction which is not permitted the result of the program interrupt occurring at that point is that the host cpu will hang in an infinite loop with interrupt disabled thus this is a denial of service vulnerability in the host which can be triggered by any guest and depending on the guest kernel it can potentially triggered by unprivileged userspace in the guest this vulnerability ha been assigned the id cve 2016 5412 to fix this we save the tm state before napping and restore it on exit from the nap when handling a h_cede in real mode the case where h_cede exit to host virtual mode is already ok a are other hcalls which exit to host virtual mode because the exit path save the tm state cc stable vger kernel org v3 15 signed off by paul mackerras paulus ozlabs org

attach do not send procfd to attached process so far we opened a file descriptor refering to proc on the host inside the host namespace and handed that fd to the attached process in attach_child_main this wa done to ensure that lsm label were correctly setup however by exploiting a potential kernel bug ptrace could be used to prevent the file descriptor from being closed which in turn could be used by an unprivileged container to gain access to the host namespace aside from this needing an upstream kernel fix we should make sure that we don t pas the fd for proc itself to the attached process however we cannot completely prevent this a the attached process need to be able to change it apparmor profile by writing to proc self attr exec or proc self attr current to minimize the attack surface we only send the fd for proc self attr exec or proc self attr current to the attached process to do this we introduce a little more ipc between the child and parent ipc mechanism x is receiver initial process intermediate attached x send pid of attached proc then exit send 0 x do initialization x send 1 add to cgroup send 2 x set lxc_attach_no_new_privs x send 3 open lsm label fd send 4 x set lsm label close socket close socket run program the attached child tell the parent when it is ready to have it lsm label set up the parent then open an approriate fd for the child pid to proc pid attr exec or proc pid attr current and sends it via scm_rights to the child the child can then set it lsm laben both side then close the socket fds and the child exec the requested process signed off by christian brauner christian brauner canonical com

kvm x86 fix emulator buffer overflow cve 2014 0049 the problem occurs when the guest performs a pusha with the stack address pointing to an mmio address or an invalid guest physical address to start with but then extending into an ordinary guest physical address when doing repeated emulated push emulator_read_write set mmio_needed to 1 on the first one on a later push when the stack point to regular memory mmio_nr_fragments is set to 0 but mmio_is_needed is not set to 0 a a result kvm exit to userspace and then return to complete_emulated_mmio in complete_emulated_mmio vcpu mmio_cur_fragment is incremented the termination condition of vcpu mmio_cur_fragment vcpu mmio_nr_fragments is never achieved the code bounce back and fourth to userspace incrementing mmio_cur_fragment past it s buffer if the guest doe nothing else it eventually lead to a a crash on a memcpy from invalid memory address however if a guest code can cause the vm to be destroyed in another vcpu with excellent timing then kvm_clear_async_pf_completion_queue can be used by the guest to control the data that s pointed to by the call to cancel_work_item which can be used to gain execution fix f78146b0f9230765c6315b2e14f56112513389ad signed off by andrew honig ahonig google com cc stable vger kernel org 3 5 signed off by paolo bonzini pbonzini redhat com

further fix the fix to cve 2017 5485 1 take the length of the nsap into account otherwise if in our search of the hash table we come across a byte string that s shorter than the string we re looking for we ll search past the end of the string in the hash table 2 the first byte of the byte string in the table is the length of the nsap with the byte after that being the first byte of the nsap but the first byte of the byte string passed into lookup_nsap is the first byte of the nsap with the length passed in a a separate argument do the comparison correctly this fix a vulnerability discovered by kamil frankowicz add a test using the capture file supplied by the reporter s while we re at it clean up the fix to lookup_bytestring 1 get rid of an unused structure member and an unused define 2 get rid of an incorrect 1 when calculating the size of the byte array to allocate that wa left over from the nsap table where the length wa guaranteed to fit in 1 byte and we used the first byte of the array to hold the length of the rest of the array

usb serial ch341 fix baud rate and line control handling revert to using direct register writes to set the divisor and line control register a recent change switched to using the init vendor command to update these register something which also enabled support for ch341a device it turn out that simply setting bit 7 in the divisor register is sufficient to support ch341a and specifically prevent data from being buffered until a full endpoint size packet 32 byte ha been received using the init command also had the side effect of temporarily deasserting the dtr rts signal on every termios change including initialisation on open something which for example could cause problem in setup where dtr is used to trigger a reset fix 4e46c410e050 usb serial ch341 reinitialize chip on reconfiguration signed off by johan hovold johan kernel org

security fix lua cmsgpack library stack overflow during an auditing effort the apple vulnerability research team discovered a critical redis security issue affecting the lua scripting part of redis description of the problem several year ago i merged a pull request including many small change at the lua msgpack library that originally i authored myself the pull request entered redis in commit 90b6337c1 in 2014 unfortunately one of the change included a variadic lua function that lacked the check for the available lua c stack a a result calling the pack msgpack library function with a large number of argument result into pushing into the lua c stack a number of new value proportional to the number of argument the function wa called with the pushed value moreover are controlled by untrusted user input this in turn cause stack smashing which we believe to be exploitable while not very deterministic but it is likely that an exploit could be created targeting specific version of redis executables however at it minimum the issue result in a do crashing the redis server version affected version greater or equal to redis 2 8 18 are affected reproducing reproduce with this based on the original reproduction script by apple security team http gist github com antirez 82445fcbea6d9b19f97014cc6cc79f8a verification of the fix the fix wa tested in the following way 1 i checked that the problem is no longer observable running the trigger 2 the lua code wa analyzed to understand the stack semantics and that actually enough stack is allocated in all the case of mp_pack call 3 the mp_pack function wa modified in order to show exactly what item in the stack were being set to make sure that there is no silent overflow even after the fix credit thank you to the apple team and to the other person that helped me checking the patch and coordinating this communication

kvm unmap page from the iommu when slot are removed commit 32f6daad4651a748a58a3ab6da0611862175722f upstream we ve been adding new mapping but not destroying old mapping this can lead to a page leak a page are pinned using get_user_pages but only unpinned with put_page if they still exist in the memslots list on vm shutdown a memslot that is destroyed while an iommu domain is enabled for the guest will therefore result in an elevated page reference count that is never cleared additionally without this fix the iommu is only programmed with the first translation for a gpa this can result in peer to peer error if a mapping is destroyed and replaced by a new mapping at the same gpa a the iommu will still be pointing to the original pinned memory address signed off by alex williamson alex williamson redhat com signed off by marcelo tosatti mtosatti redhat com signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh linuxfoundation org

cve 2017 15112 unsafe use of p admin password on command line it is unsafe to pas a password a part of the command line args because it appears in the process info and is recorded in the shell command history the p keycloak admin password arg ha been replaced with p keycloak admin password file which read the password from a file or stdin if given a hyphen the now deprecated keycloak admin password also accepted stdin with a hyphen this wa retained for backward compatibility during a transition period it will issue a deprecation warning trying to use keycloak admin password with anything other than a hyphen will result in an error and explanation the man page wa updated to include a section on password passing and includes documention on using the keycloak_admin_password environment variable which wa always supported but never documented the admin password command line arg in keycloak_cli py wa also updated in a similar manner and now also includes support for keycloak_admin_password environment variable

ftrace fix checking of trampoline ftrace_ops in finding trampoline when modifying code ftrace ha several check to make sure thing are being done correctly one of them is to make sure any code it modifies is exactly what it expects it to be before it modifies it in order to do so with the new trampoline logic it must be able to find out what trampoline a function is hooked to in order to see if the code that hook to it is what s expected the logic to find the trampoline from a record accounting descriptor for a function that is hooked need to only look at the old_hash of an ops that is being modified the old_hash is the list of function an ops is hooked to before it update since a record would only be pointing to an ops that is being modified if it wa already hooked before currently it can pick a modified ops based on it new function it will be hooked to and this pick the wrong trampoline and cause the check to fail disabling ftrace signed off by steven rostedt rostedt goodmis org ftrace squash into ordering of ops for modification

bridge start hello_timer when enabling kernel_stp in br_stp_start since commit 76b91c32dd86 bridge stp when using userspace stp stop kernel hello and hold timer bridge would not start hello_timer if stp_enabled is not kernel_stp when br_dev_open the problem is even if user set stp_enabled with kernel_stp later the timer will still not be started it cause that kernel_stp can not really work user have to re ifup the bridge to avoid this this patch is to fix it by starting br hello_timer when enabling kernel_stp in br_stp_start a an improvement it s also to start hello_timer again only when br stp_enabled is kernel_stp in br_hello_timer_expired there is no reason to start the timer again when it s no_stp fix 76b91c32dd86 bridge stp when using userspace stp stop kernel hello and hold timer reported by haidong li haili redhat com signed off by xin long lucien xin gmail com acked by nikolay aleksandrov nikolay cumulusnetworks com reviewed by ivan vecera cera cera cz signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

xfs remote attribute overwrite cause transaction overrun commit e461fcb xfs remote attribute lookup require the value length pass the remote attribute length in the xfs_da_args structure on lookup so that crc calculation and validity checking can be performed correctly by related code this unfortunately ha the side effect of changing the args valuelen parameter in case where it shouldn t that is when we replace a remote attribute the incoming replacement store the value and length in args value and args valuelen but then the lookup which find the existing remote attribute overwrites args valuelen with the length of the remote attribute being replaced hence when we go to create the new attribute we create it of the size of the existing remote attribute not the size it is supposed to be when the new attribute is much smaller than the old attribute this result in a transaction overrun and an assert failure on a debug kernel xfs assertion failed tp t_blk_res_used tp t_blk_res file f xfs xfs_trans c line 331 fix this by keeping the remote attribute value length separate to the attribute value length in the xfs_da_args structure the enables u to pas the length of the remote attribute to be removed without overwriting the new attribute s length also ensure that when we save remote block context for a later rename we zero the original state variable so that we don t confuse the state of the attribute to be remove with the state of the new attribute that we just added spotted by brain foster signed off by dave chinner dchinner redhat com reviewed by brian foster bfoster redhat com signed off by dave chinner david fromorbit com

key fix race between updating and finding a negative key consolidate key_flag_instantiated key_flag_negative and the rejection error into one field such that 1 the instantiation state can be modified read atomically 2 the error can be accessed atomically with the state 3 the error isn t stored unioned with the payload pointer this deal with the problem that the state is spread over three different object two bit and a separate variable and reading or updating them atomically isn t practical given that not only can uninstantiated key change into instantiated or rejected key but rejected key can also turn into instantiated key and someone accessing the key might not be using any locking the main side effect of this problem is that what wa held in the payload may change depending on the state for instance you might observe the key to be in the rejected state you then read the cached error but if the key semaphore wasn t locked the key might ve become instantiated between the two read and you might now have something in hand that isn t actually an error code the state is now key_is_uninstantiated key_is_positive or a negative error code if the key is negatively instantiated the key_is_instantiated function is replaced with key_is_positive to avoid confusion a negative key are also instantiated additionally barriering is included 1 order payload set before state set during instantiation 2 order state read before payload read when using the key further separate barriering is necessary if rcu is being used to access the payload content after reading the payload pointer fix 146aa8b1453b key merge the type specific data with the payload data cc stable vger kernel org v4 4 reported by eric biggers ebiggers google com signed off by david howells dhowells redhat com reviewed by eric biggers ebiggers google com

bpf fix incorrect tracking of register size truncation properly handle register truncation to a smaller size the old code first mirror the clearing of the high 32 bit in the bitwise tristate representation which is correct but then it computes the new arithmetic bound a the intersection between the old arithmetic bound and the bound resulting from the bitwise tristate representation therefore when coerce_reg_to_32 is called on a number with bound 0xffff fff8 0x1 0000 0007 the verifier computes 0xffff fff8 0xffff ffff a bound of the truncated number this is incorrect the truncated number could also be in the range 0 7 and no meaningful arithmetic bound can be computed in that case apart from the obvious 0 0xffff ffff starting with v4 14 this is exploitable by unprivileged user a long a the unprivileged_bpf_disabled sysctl isn t set debian assigned cve 2017 16996 for this issue v2 flip the mask during arithmetic bound calculation ben hutchings v3 add cve number ben hutchings fix b03c9f9fdc37 bpf verifier track signed and unsigned min max value signed off by jann horn jannh google com acked by edward cree ecree solarflare com signed off by alexei starovoitov ast kernel org signed off by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net

server fix two issue identified by asan 1 if the tlsplain and x509plain security type were both disabled then rfboptpamauth would overflow the name field in the sectypes structure when testing the none security type since the name of that security type ha le than five character this issue wa innocuous since the overflow wa fully contained within the sectypes structure but the asan error caused xvnc to abort which made it difficult to detect other error 2 if an ill behaved rfb client sent the turbovnc server a fence message with more than 64 byte then the turbovnc server would try to read that message and subsequently overflow the stack before it detected that the payload wa too large this could never have occurred with any of the vnc viewer that currently support the rfb flow control extension tigervnc and turbovnc namely this issue wa also innocuous since the stack overflow affected two variable newscreens and errmsg that were never accessed before the function returned

net bridge fix locking in br_fdb_find_port caller of br_fdb_find need to hold the hash lock which br_fdb_find_port doesn t do however since br_fdb_find_port is not doing any actual fdb manipulation the hash lock is not really needed at all so convert to br_fdb_find_rcu surrounded by rcu_read_lock _unlock pair the device pointer copied from inside the fdb entry is then kept alive by the rtnl lock which br_fdb_find_port asserts fix 4d4fd36126d6 net bridge publish bridge accessor function signed off by petr machata petrm mellanox com acked by nikolay aleksandrov nikolay cumulusnetworks com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

x86 msr add capability check at the moment the msr driver only relies upon file system check this mean that anything a root with any capability set can write to msrs historically that wasn t very interesting but on modern processor the msrs are such that writing to them provides several way to execute arbitary code in kernel space sample code and documentation on doing this is circulating and msr attack are used on window 64bit rootkits already in the linux case you still need to be able to open the device file so the impact is fairly limited and reduces the security of some capability and security model based system down towards that of a generic root owns the box setup therefore they should require cap_sys_rawio to prevent an elevation of capability the impact of this is fairly minimal on most setup because they don t have heavy use of capability those using selinux smack or apparmor rule might want to consider if their rulesets on the msr driver could be tighter signed off by alan cox alan linux intel com cc linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org cc andrew morton akpm linux foundation org cc peter zijlstra a p zijlstra chello nl cc horse stable kernel org signed off by ingo molnar mingo kernel org

mm oom_reaper gather each vma to prevent leaking tlb entry tlb_gather_mmu tlb mm 0 1 mean gathering the whole virtual memory space in this case tlb fullmm is true some arch like arm64 doesn t flush tlb when tlb fullmm is true commit 5a7862e83000 arm64 tlbflush avoid flushing when fullmm 1 which cause leaking of tlb entry will clarifies his patch basically we tag each address space with an asid pcid on x86 which is resident in the tlb this mean we can elide tlb invalidation when pulling down a full mm because we won t ever assign that asid to another mm without doing tlb invalidation elsewhere which actually just nuke the whole tlb i think that mean that we could potentially not fault on a kernel uaccess because we could hit in the tlb there could be a window between complete_signal sending ipi to other core and all thread sharing this mm are really kicked off from core in this window the oom reaper may call tlb_flush_mmu_tlbonly to flush tlb then free page however due to the above problem the tlb entry are not really flushed on arm64 other thread are possible to access these page through tlb entry moreover a copy_to_user can also write to these page without generating page fault cause use after free bug this patch gather each vma instead of gathering full vm space in this case tlb fullmm is not true the behavior of oom reaper become similar to munmapping before do_exit which should be safe for all arch link http lkml kernel org r 20171107095453 179940 1 wangnan0 huawei com fix aac453635549 mm oom introduce oom reaper signed off by wang nan the generation of the configuration file jas_config h ha been completely reworked in order to avoid pollution of the global namespace some problematic type like uchar ulong and friend have been replaced with name with a jas_ prefix an option max_samples ha been added to the bmp and jpeg decoder to restrict the maximum size of image that they can decode this change wa made a a possibly temporary fix to address security concern a max_samples command line option ha also been added to imginfo whether an image component for jas_image_t is stored in memory or on disk is now based on the component size rather than the image size some debug log message were added some new integer overflow check were added some new safe integer add multiply function were added more pre c99 cruft wa removed jasper ha numerous hack to handle pre c99 compiler jasper now assumes c99 support so this pre c99 cruft is unnecessary and can be removed the regression jasper doublefree mem_close jpg ha been re enabled theoretically it should work more predictably now

check permission in acl plugin s rpc api component 1056 security fix severity medium type remote priviledge escalation remote yes vulnerability detail this fix a security hole in the acl plugins remote api component the plugin failed to check for superuser permission before executing acl addition or deletion this mean everybody with permission to call the xmlrpc api also had permission to set up their own acl rule and thus circumventing any existing rule risk assessment the xmlrpc api in dokuwiki is marked experimental and off by default it also implement an additional safeguard by giving access to a configured circle of user and group only so only a minor number of dokuwiki installation will be affected at all for affected installation the risk is high if user with access to the api are not to be trusted thus the overall severity of medium resolution installation applying this commit are safe a hotfix is about to be released meanwhile user are advised to disable the xmlrpc api in the config manager

detect invalid port in xp_socket parse ip address for historical reason fsockopen accepts the port and hostname separately fsockopen 127 0 0 1 80 however with the introdcution of stream transport in php 4 3 it became possible to include the port in the hostname specifier fsockopen 127 0 0 1 80 or more formally fsockopen tcp 127 0 0 1 80 confusing result when these two form are combined however fsockopen 127 0 0 1 80 443 result in fsockopen attempting to connect to 127 0 0 1 80 443 which any reasonable stack would consider invalid unfortunately php par the address looking for the first colon with special handling for ipv6 don t worry and call atoi from there atoi in turn simply stop parsing at the first non numeric character and return the value so far the end result is that the explicitly supplied port is treated a ignored garbage rather than producing an error this diff replaces atoi with strtol and inspects the stop character if additional garbage of any kind is found it fails and return an error
