floppy fix out of bound read in copy_buffer upstream commit da99466ac243f15fbba65bd261bfc75ffa1532b6 this fix a global out of bound read access in the copy_buffer function of the floppy driver the fddefprm ioctl allows one to set the geometry of a disk the sect and head field unsigned int of the floppy_drive structure are used to compute the max_sector int in the make_raw_rw_request function it is possible to overflow the max_sector next max_sector is passed to the copy_buffer function and used in one of the memcpy call an unprivileged user could trigger the bug if the device is accessible but requires a floppy disk to be inserted the patch add the check for the sect head multiplication for not overflowing in the set_geometry function the bug wa found by syzkaller signed off by denis efremov efremov ispras ru tested by willy tarreau w 1wt eu signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org signed off by sasha levin sashal kernel org

fix null deref in spnego acceptor cve 2014 4344 when processing a continuation token acc_ctx_cont wa dereferencing the initial byte of the token without checking the length this could result in a null dereference cve 2014 4344 in mit krb5 1 5 and newer an unauthenticated or partially authenticated remote attacker can cause a null dereference and application crash during a spnego negotiation by sending an empty token a the second or later context token from initiator to acceptor the attacker must provide at least one valid context token in the security context negotiation before sending the empty token this can be done by an unauthenticated attacker by forcing spnego to renegotiate the underlying mechanism or by using iakerb to wrap an unauthenticated a req a the first token cvssv2 vector av n ac l au n c n i n a c e poc rl of rc c kaduk mit edu cve summary cvssv2 vector cherry picked from commit 524688ce87a15fc75f87efc8c039ba4c7d5c197b ticket 7970 version_fixed 1 12 2 status resolved

ptrace x86 force iret path after a ptrace_stop the sysret fastpath doe not correctly restore even all regular register much le any segment register or reflags value that is very much part of why it s faster than iret normally that isn t a problem because the normal ptrace interface catch the process using the signal handler infrastructure which always return with an iret however some path can get caught using ptrace_event instead of the signal path and for those we need to make sure that we aren t going to return to user space using sysret otherwise the modification that may have been done to the register set by the tracer wouldn t necessarily take effect fix it by forcing iret path by setting tif_notify_resume from arch_ptrace_stop_needed which is invoked from ptrace_stop signed off by tejun heo tj kernel org reported by andy lutomirski luto amacapital net acked by oleg nesterov oleg redhat com suggested by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org cc stable vger kernel org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

change mincore to count mapped page rather than cached page the semantics of what in core mean for the mincore system call are somewhat unclear but linux ha always since 2 3 52 which is when mincore wa initially done treated it a page is available in page cache rather than page is mapped in the mapping the problem with that traditional semantic is that it expose a lot of system cache state that it really probably shouldn t and that user shouldn t really even care about so let s try to avoid that information leak by simply changing the semantics to be that mincore count actual mapped page not page that might be cheaply mapped if they were faulted note the might be part of the old semantics being in the cache doesn t actually guarantee that you can access them without io anyway since thing like network filesystems may have to revalidate the cache before use in many way the old semantics were somewhat insane even aside from the information leak issue from the very beginning and that beginning is a long time ago 2 3 52 wa released in march 2000 i think the code had a comment saying later we can get more picky about what in core mean precisely and this is that later admittedly it is much later than is really comfortable note this is a real semantic change and it is for example known to change the output of fincore since that program literally doe a mmmap without populating it and then doing mincore on that mapping that doesn t actually have any page in it i m hoping that nobody actually ha any workflow that care and the info leak is real we may have to do something different if it turn out that people have valid reason to want the old semantics and if we can limit the information leak sanely cc kevin easton kevin guarana org cc jiri kosina jikos kernel org cc masatake yamato yamato redhat com cc andrew morton akpm linux foundation org cc greg kh gregkh linuxfoundation org cc peter zijlstra peterz infradead org cc michal hocko mhocko suse com signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

set_fat fix off by 2 error leading to corruption in fat12 in fat12 two 12 bit entry are combined to a 24 bit value three byte therefore when an even numbered fat entry is set in fat12 it must be be combined with the following entry to prevent accessing beyond the end of the fat array it must be checked that the cluster is not the last one previously the check tested that the requested cluster wa equal to f cluster 1 however f cluster is the number of data cluster not including the two reserved fat entry at the start so the test triggered two cluster early if the third to last entry wa written on a fat12 filesystem with an odd number of cluster the second to last entry would be corrupted this corruption may also lead to invalid memory access when the corrupted entry becomes out of bound and is used later change the test to f cluster 1 to fix reported by hanno böck signed off by andreas bombe aeb debian org

alsa hrtimer fix stall by hrtimer_cancel hrtimer_cancel wait for the completion from the callback thus it must not be called inside the callback itself this wa already a problem in the past with alsa hrtimer driver and the early commit fcfdebe70759 alsa hrtimer fix lock up tried to address it however the previous fix is still insufficient it may still cause a lockup when the alsa timer instance reprograms itself in it callback then it invokes the start function even in snd_timer_interrupt that is called in hrtimer callback itself result in a cpu stall this is no hypothetical problem but actually triggered by syzkaller fuzzer this patch try to fix the issue again now we call hrtimer_try_to_cancel at both start and stop function so that it won t fall into a deadlock yet giving some chance to cancel the queue if the function have been called outside the callback the proper hrtimer_cancel is called in anyway at closing so this should be enough reported and tested by dmitry vyukov dvyukov google com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by takashi iwai tiwai suse de

net compute protocol sequence number and fragment id using md5 computer have become a lot faster since we compromised on the partial md4 hash which we use currently for performance reason md5 is a much safer choice and is inline with both rfc1948 and other i generator openbsd solaris etc furthermore only having 24 bit of the sequence number be truly unpredictable is a very serious limitation so the periodic regeneration and 8 bit counter have been removed we compute and use a full 32 bit sequence number for ipv6 dccp wa found to use a 32 bit truncated initial sequence number it need 43 bit and that is fixed here a well reported by dan kaminsky dan doxpara com tested by willy tarreau w 1wt eu signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

fix 12630 print_bugnote_inc php x with unescaped reminder usernames a minor x issue exists with print_bugnote_inc php whereby usernames are not properly sanitised prior to being outputted step to reproduce 1 create a user with a username of hack script alert 1 script note mantisbt will not let people create these malformed usernames by default a only latin character are accepted therefore you must create the user with sql or another raw approach 2 send a reminder to this new user from inside a bug 3 go to the print view of the bug 4 notice an alert window pop up indicating an x issue note this is not a major security issue because mantisbt prevents people from making malformed usernames by default it s only an issue if you re adding user to mantisbt using your own approach a third party user creation script and writing directly to the database instead of using mantisbt s api

ignore a project link in bsrequestaction check_action_permission this make sure that we check the permission of the correct package for instance assume that the project staging is a link project where the link point to the base project also assume that there exists a base foo package but there exists no explicit staging foo package moreover assume we check the permission for the following submit action action type submit source project staging package foo target project an_arbitrary_project package foo action in this case the old code check if request acceptor can modify the base foo package since it follows the project link this is wrong because the staging foo package would be turned into a branch during accept the new code check the correct package because it doe not follow the project link and requires that the source package exists in the source project requiring the existence of the source package potentially break artificial request for instance a request where the submit action from above is preceded by a submit action that creates a staging foo package note so far i wa unable to exploit the old code so this is just to avoid a potential future headache fix commit 990ef7ccc api webui check access to source package

x86 mm aslr fix stack randomization on 64 bit system the issue is that the stack for process is not properly randomized on 64 bit architecture due to an integer overflow the affected function is randomize_stack_top in file f binfmt_elf c static unsigned long randomize_stack_top unsigned long stack_top unsigned int random_variable 0 if current flag pf_randomize current personality addr_no_randomize random_variable get_random_int stack_rnd_mask random_variable page_shift return page_align stack_top random_variable return page_align stack_top random_variable note that it declares the random_variable variable a unsigned int since the result of the shifting operation between stack_rnd_mask which is 0x3fffff on x86_64 22 bit and page_shift which is 12 on x86_64 random_variable page_shift then the two leftmost bit are dropped when storing the result in the random_variable this variable shall be at least 34 bit long to hold the 22 12 result these two dropped bit have an impact on the entropy of process stack concretely the total stack entropy is reduced by four from 2 28 to 2 30 one fourth of expected entropy this patch restores back the entropy by correcting the type involved in the operation in the function randomize_stack_top and stack_maxrandom_size the successful fix can be tested with for i in seq 1 10 do cat proc self map grep stack done 7ffeda566000 7ffeda587000 rw p 00000000 00 00 0 stack 7fff5a332000 7fff5a353000 rw p 00000000 00 00 0 stack 7ffcdb7a1000 7ffcdb7c2000 rw p 00000000 00 00 0 stack 7ffd5e2c4000 7ffd5e2e5000 rw p 00000000 00 00 0 stack once corrected the leading byte should be between 7ffc and 7fff rather than always being 7fff signed off by hector marco gisbert hecmargi upv e signed off by ismael ripoll iripoll upv e rebased cifs fix cifsacl mount over smb2 to not call cifs when mounting with smb2 smb3 e g vers 2 1 and cifsacl mount option it wa trying to get the mode by querying the acl over the cifs rather than smb2 protocol this patch make that protocol independent and make cifsacl smb2 mount return a more intuitive operation not supported error until we add a worker function for smb2_get_acl note that a previous patch fixed getxattr setxattr for the cifsacl xattr which would unconditionally call cifs_get_acl and cifs_set_acl even when mounted smb2 i made those protocol independent last week new protocol version operation get_acl and set_acl but did not add an smb2_get_acl and smb2_set_acl yet so those now simply return eopnotsupp which at least is better than sending cifs request on smb2 mount the previous patch did not fix the one remaining case though ie mounting with cifsacl when getting mode from acl would unconditionally end up calling cifs_get_acl_from_fid even for smb2 so made that protocol independent but to make that protocol independent had to make sure that the caller were passing the protocol independent handle structure cifs_fid instead of cifs specific _u16 network file handle ie cifs_fid instead of cifs_fid fid now mount with smb2 and cifsacl mount option will return eopnotsup instead of timing out and a future patch will add smb2 operation e g get_smb2_acl to enable this signed off by steve french smfrench gmail com

cifs workaround macos server problem with smb2 1 write response writes fail to mac server with smb2 1 mount work with cifs though due to them sending an incorrect rfc1001 length for the smb2 1 write response workaround this problem macos server sends a write response with 3 byte of pad beyond the end of the smb itself the rfc1001 length is 3 byte more than the sum of the smb2 1 header length the write reponse incorporate feedback from jeff and jra to allow server to send a tcp frame that is even more than three byte too long ie much longer than the smb2 smb3 request that it contains but we do log it once now in the earlier version of the patch i had limited how far off the length field could be before we fail the request signed off by steve french smfrench gmail com

sf bug 131 creator jean francois dockes i know it sound crazy that nobody ever saw this but the content length value in gena notify message is too small by one it appears that most current control point don t notice the extra character an lf which is validly there but not included in content length probably because their protocol handler is reasonably lenient and because the missing body lf doe not prevent parsing the xml but there is a least one anal cp linn kazoo which barf because it read all data until connection close and the size mismatch trigger a bug proof in gena_device c 217 notify_send_and_recv ret_code http_sendmessage info timeout bbb start_msg buf start_msg length propertyset strlen propertyset crlf strlen crlf start_msg ha all the header including the empty line content length should be strlen propertyset strlen crlf 2 in gena_device c 433 allocgenaheaders rc snprintf header headers_size s s prizu s s s header_line_1 header_line_2a strlen propertyset 1 header_line_2b header_line_3 header_line_4 header_line_2a is content length the following value should be strlen propertyset 2 cherry picked from commit 91ef91e8531b86507f9a752316991221792db380

fix build_principal memory bug cve 2015 2697 in build_principal_va use k5memdup0 instead of strdup to make a copy of the realm to ensure that we allocate the correct number of byte and do not read past the end of the input string this bug affect krb5_build_principal krb5_build_principal_va and krb5_build_principal_alloc_va krb5_build_principal_ext is not affected cve 2015 2697 in mit krb5 1 7 and later an authenticated attacker may be able to cause a kdc to crash using a tgs request with a large realm field beginning with a null byte if the kdc attempt to find a referral to answer the request it construct a principal name for lookup using krb5_build_principal with the requested realm due to a bug in this function the null byte cause only one byte be allocated for the realm field of the constructed principal far le than it length subsequent operation on the lookup principal may cause a read beyond the end of the mapped memory region causing the kdc process to crash cvssv2 av n ac l au s c n i n a c e poc rl of rc c ticket 8252 new target_version 1 14 tag pullup

error code when the key is garbage collected the key destroy function is called unconditionally and keyring_destroy us list_empty on keyring type_data link which is in a union with reject_error fscrypt remove broken support for detecting keyring key revocation filesystem encryption ostensibly supported revoking a keyring key that had been used to unlock encrypted file causing those file to become locked again this wa however buggy for several reason the most severe of which wa that when key revocation happened to be detected for an inode it fscrypt_info wa immediately freed even while other thread could be using it for encryption or decryption concurrently this could be exploited to crash the kernel or worse this patch fix the use after free by removing the code which detects the keyring key having been revoked invalidated or expired instead an encrypted inode that is unlocked now simply remains unlocked until it is evicted from memory note that this is no worse than the case for block device level encryption e g dm crypt and it still remains possible for a privileged user to evict unused page inodes and dentries by running sync echo 3 proc sys vm drop_caches or by simply unmounting the filesystem in fact one of those action wa already needed anyway for key revocation to work even somewhat sanely this change is not expected to break any application in the future i d like to implement a real api for fscrypt key revocation that interacts sanely with ongoing filesystem operation waiting for existing operation to complete and blocking new operation and invalidating and sanitizing key material and plaintext from the vfs cache but this is a hard problem and for now this bug must be fixed this bug affected almost all version of ext4 f2fs and ubifs encryption and it wa potentially reachable in any kernel configured with encryption support config_ext4_encryption y config_ext4_fs_encryption y config_f2fs_fs_encryption y or config_ubifs_fs_encryption y note that older kernel did not use the shared f crypto code but due to the potential security implication of this bug it may still be worthwhile to backport this fix to them fix b7236e21d55f ext4 crypto reorganize how we store key in the inode cc stable vger kernel org v4 2 signed off by eric biggers ebiggers google com signed off by theodore t o tytso mit edu acked by michael halcrow mhalcrow google ring buffer prevent overflow of size in ring_buffer_resize if the size passed to ring_buffer_resize is greater than max_long buf_page_size then the div_round_up will return zero here s the detail echo 18014398509481980 sys kernel debug tracing buffer_size_kb tracing_entries_write process this and convert kb to byte 18014398509481980 10 18446744073709547520 and this is passed to ring_buffer_resize a unsigned long size size div_round_up size buf_page_size where div_round_up a b is a b 1 b buf_page_size is 4080 and here 18446744073709547520 4080 1 18446744073709551599 where 18446744073709551599 is still smaller than 2 64 2 64 18446744073709551599 17 but now 18446744073709551599 4080 4521260802379792 and size size 4080 18446744073709551360 this is checked to make sure it still greater than 2 4080 which it is then we convert to the number of buffer page needed nr_page div_round_up size buf_page_size but this time size is 18446744073709551360 and 2 64 18446744073709551360 4080 1 3823 thus it overflow and the resulting number is le than 4080 which make 3823 4080 0 an nr_pages is set to this a we already checked against the minimum that nr_pages may be this cause the logic to fail a well and we crash the kernel there s no reason to have the two div_round_up that s just result of historical code change clean up the code and fix this bug cc stable vger kernel org 3 5 fix 83f40318dab00 ring buffer make removal of ring buffer page atomic signed off by steven rostedt rostedt goodmis org

printk fix buffer overflow when calling log_prefix function from call_console_drivers this patch corrects a buffer overflow in kernel from 3 0 to 3 4 when calling log_prefix function from call_console_drivers this bug existed in previous release but ha been revealed with commit 162a7e7500f9664636e649ba59defe541b7c2c60 2 6 39 3 0 that made change about how to allocate memory for early printk buffer use of memblock_alloc it disappears with commit 7ff9554bb578ba02166071d2d487b7fc7d860d62 3 4 3 5 that doe a refactoring of printk buffer management in log_prefix the access to p 0 p 1 p 2 or simple_strtoul p 1 endp 10 may cause a buffer overflow a this function is called from call_console_drivers by passing log_buf cur_index where the index must be masked to do not exceed the buffer s boundary the trick is to prepare in call_console_drivers a buffer with the necessary data pri field of syslog message to be safely evaluated in log_prefix this patch can be applied to stable kernel branch 3 0 y 3 2 y and 3 4 y without this patch one can freeze a server running this loop from shell export dummy cat dev urandom tr dc 12345azertyuiopqsdfghjklmwxcvbnazertyuiopqsdfghjklmwxcvbn head c255 while true do echo dummy dev kmsg done the server freeze depends on where memblock_alloc doe allocate printk buffer if the buffer overflow is inside another kernel allocation the problem may not be revealed else the server may hang up signed off by alexandre simon alexandre simon univ lorraine fr signed off by greg kroah hartman gregkh linuxfoundation org

key potential uninitialized variable if __key_link_begin failed then edit would be uninitialized i ve added a check to fix that this allows a random user to crash the kernel though it s quite difficult to achieve there are three way it can be done a the user would have to cause an error to occur in __key_link 1 cause the kernel to run out of memory in practice this is difficult to achieve without enomem cropping up elsewhere and aborting the attempt 2 revoke the destination keyring between the keyring id being looked up and it being tested for revocation in practice this is difficult to time correctly because the keyctl_reject function can only be used from the request key upcall process further user can only make use of what s in sbin request key conf though this doe including a rejection debugging test which mean that the destination keyring ha to be the caller s session keyring in practice 3 have just enough key quota available to create a key a new session keyring for the upcall and a link in the session keyring but not then sufficient quota to create a link in the nominated destination keyring so that it fails with edquot the bug can be triggered using option 3 above using something like the following echo 80 proc sys kernel key root_maxbytes keyctl request2 user debug fred negate t the above set the quota to something much lower 80 to make the bug easier to trigger but this is dependent on the system note also that the name of the keyring created contains a random number that may be between 1 and 10 character in size so may throw the test off by changing the amount of quota used assuming the failure occurs something like the following will be seen kfree_debugcheck out of range ptr 6b6b6b6b6b6b6b68h cut here kernel bug at mm slab c 2821 rip 0010 fix spnego context aliasing bug cve 2015 2695 the spnego mechanism currently replaces it context handle with the mechanism context handle upon establishment under the assumption that most g function are only called after context establishment this assumption is incorrect and can lead to aliasing violation for some program maintain the spnego context structure after context establishment and refer to it in all g method add initiate and opened flag to the spnego context structure for use in gss_inquire_context prior to context establishment cve 2015 2695 in mit krb5 1 5 and later application which call gss_inquire_context on a partially established spnego context can cause the g api library to read from a pointer using the wrong type generally causing a process crash this bug may go unnoticed because the most common spnego authentication scenario establishes the context after just one call to gss_accept_sec_context java server application using the native jgss provider are vulnerable to this bug a carefully crafted spnego packet might allow the gss_inquire_context call to succeed with attacker determined result but application should not make access control decision based on gss_inquire_context result prior to context establishment cvssv2 vector av n ac m au n c n i n a c e poc rl of rc c ghudson mit edu several bugfixes style change and edge case behavior change commit message and cve description ticket 8244 target_version 1 14 tag pullup

help clean up kfmclient munging when we are going to launch path to konqueror we instead rewrite this into path to kfmclient by duplicating the original string and writing over the ending bit this can be done more obviously with strip_suffix and xstrfmt note that we also fix a subtle bug with the filename parameter which is passed a argv 0 to the child if the user ha configured a program name with no directory component we always pas the string kfmclient even if your program is called something else but if you give a full path we give the basename of that path but more bizarrely if we rewrite konqueror to kfmclient we still pas konqueror the history of this function doesn t reveal anything interesting so it look like just an oversight from combining the suffix munging with the basename finding let s just call basename on the munged path which produce consistent result if you gave a program whether a full path or not we pas it basename probably this doesn t matter at all in practice but it make the code slightly le confusing to read signed off by jeff king peff peff net signed off by junio c hamano gitster pobox com

fix up non directory creation in sgid directory sgid directory have special semantics making newly created file in the directory belong to the group of the directory and newly created subdirectory will also become sgid this is historically used for group shared directory but group directory writable by non group member should not imply that such non group member can magically join the group so make sure to clear the sgid bit on non directory for non member but remember that sgid without group execute mean mandatory locking just to confuse thing even more reported by jann horn jannh google com cc andy lutomirski luto kernel org cc al viro viro zeniv linux org uk signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

x86_64 trap stop using ist for s on a 32 bit kernel this ha no effect since there are no ist stack on a 64 bit kernel s can only happen in user code on a failed iret to user space a canonical violation on access via rsp or rbp or a genuine stack segment violation in 32 bit kernel code the first two case don t need ist and the latter two case are unlikely fatal bug and promoting them to double fault would be fine this fix a bug in which the espfix64 code mishandles a stack segment violation this save 4k of memory per cpu and a tiny bit of code signed off by andy lutomirski luto amacapital net reviewed by thomas gleixner tglx linutronix de cc stable vger kernel org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

zram support bdi_cap_stable_writes zram ha used per cpu stream feature from v4 7 it aim for increasing cache hit ratio of scratch buffer for compressing downside of that approach is that zram should ask memory space for compressed page in per cpu context which requires stricted gfp flag which could be failed if so it retries to allocate memory space out of per cpu context so it could get memory this time and compress the data again copy it to the memory space in this scenario zram assumes the data should never be changed but it is not true without stable page support so if the data is changed under u zram can make buffer overrun so that zsmalloc free object chain is broken so system go crash like below http bugzilla suse com show_bug cgi id 997574 this patch add bdi_cap_stable_writes to zram for declaring i am block device needing stable write fix da9556a2367c zram user per cpu compression stream link http lkml kernel org r 1482366980 3782 4 git send email minchan kernel org signed off by minchan kim minchan kernel org reviewed by sergey senozhatsky sergey senozhatsky gmail com cc takashi iwai tiwai suse de cc hyeoncheol lee cheol lee lge com cc yjay kim lge com cc sangseok lee sangseok lee lge com cc hugh dickins hughd google com cc darrick j wong darrick wong oracle com cc stable vger kernel org 4 7 signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

crypto arm aes update neon aes module to latest openssl version this update the bit sliced aes module to the latest version in the upstream openssl repository e620e5ae37bc this is needed to fix a bug in the xt decryption path where data chunked in a certain way could trigger the ciphertext stealing code which is not supposed to be active in the kernel build the kernel implementation of xt only support round multiple of the aes block size of 16 byte whereas the conformant openssl implementation of xt support input of arbitrary size by applying ciphertext stealing this is fixed in the upstream version by adding the missing ifndef xts_chain_tweak around the offending instruction the upstream code also contains the change applied by russell to build the code unconditionally i e even if __linux_arm_arch__ 7 but implemented slightly differently cc stable vger kernel org fix e4e7f10bfc40 arm add support for bit sliced aes using neon instruction reported by adrian kotelba adrian kotelba gmail com signed off by ard biesheuvel ard biesheuvel linaro org tested by milan broz gmazyland gmail com signed off by herbert xu herbert gondor apana org au

bpf 32 bit rsh verification must truncate input before the alu op when i wrote commit 468f6eafa6c4 bpf fix 32 bit alu op verification i assumed that in order to emulate 64 bit arithmetic with 32 bit logic it is sufficient to just truncate the output to 32 bit and so i just moved the register size coercion that used to be at the start of the function to the end of the function that assumption is true for almost every op but not for 32 bit right shift because those can propagate information towards the least significant bit fix it by always truncating input for 32 bit ops to 32 bit also get rid of the coerce_reg_to_size after the alu op since that ha no effect fix 468f6eafa6c4 bpf fix 32 bit alu op verification acked by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net signed off by jann horn jannh google com signed off by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net

detect invalid port in xp_socket parse ip address for historical reason fsockopen accepts the port and hostname separately fsockopen 127 0 0 1 80 however with the introdcution of stream transport in php 4 3 it became possible to include the port in the hostname specifier fsockopen 127 0 0 1 80 or more formally fsockopen tcp 127 0 0 1 80 confusing result when these two form are combined however fsockopen 127 0 0 1 80 443 result in fsockopen attempting to connect to 127 0 0 1 80 443 which any reasonable stack would consider invalid unfortunately php par the address looking for the first colon with special handling for ipv6 don t worry and call atoi from there atoi in turn simply stop parsing at the first non numeric character and return the value so far the end result is that the explicitly supplied port is treated a ignored garbage rather than producing an error this diff replaces atoi with strtol and inspects the stop character if additional garbage of any kind is found it fails and return an error

dm allocate struct mapped_device with kvzalloc the structure srcu_struct can be very big it size is proportional to the value config_nr_cpus the fedora kernel ha config_nr_cpus 8192 the field io_barrier in the struct mapped_device ha 84kb in the debugging kernel and 50kb in the non debugging kernel the large size may result in failure of the function kzalloc_node in order to avoid the allocation failure we use the function kvzalloc_node this function fall back to vmalloc if a large contiguous chunk of memory is not available this patch also move the field io_barrier to the last position of struct mapped_device the reason is that on many processor architecture short memory offset result in smaller code than long memory offset on x86 64 it reduces code size by 320 byte note to stable kernel maintainer the kernel 4 11 and older don t have the function kvzalloc_node you can use the function vzalloc_node instead signed off by mikulas patocka mpatocka redhat com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by mike snitzer snitzer redhat com

smart_pkt fix potential oob read when processing ng packet os fuzz ha reported a potential out of bound read when processing a ng smart packet 1 error addresssanitizer heap buffer overflow on address 0x6310000249c0 at pc 0x000000493a92 bp 0x7ffddc882cd0 sp 0x7ffddc882480 read of size 65529 at 0x6310000249c0 thread t0 scariness 26 multi byte read heap buffer overflow 0 0x493a91 in __interceptor_strchr part 35 src llvm project compiler rt lib sanitizer_common sanitizer_common_interceptors inc 673 1 0x813960 in ng_pkt libgit2 src transport smart_pkt c 320 14 2 0x810f79 in git_pkt_parse_line libgit2 src transport smart_pkt c 478 9 3 0x82c3c9 in git_smart__store_refs libgit2 src transport smart_protocol c 47 12 4 0x6373a2 in git_smart__connect libgit2 src transport smart c 251 15 5 0x57688f in git_remote_connect libgit2 src remote c 708 15 6 0x52e59b in llvmfuzzertestoneinput src download_refs_fuzzer cc 145 9 7 0x52ef3f in executefilesonybyone int char src libfuzzer afl afl_driver cpp 301 5 8 0x52f4ee in main src libfuzzer afl afl_driver cpp 339 12 9 0x7f6c910db82f in __libc_start_main build glibc cl5g7w glibc 2 23 csu libc start c 291 10 0x41d518 in _start when parsing an ng packet we keep track of both the current position a well a the remaining length of the packet itself but instead of taking care not to exceed the length we pas the current pointer s position to strchr which will search for a certain character until hitting nul it is thus possible to create a crafted packet which doesn t contain a nul byte to trigger an out of bound read fix the issue by instead using memchr passing the remaining length a restriction furthermore verify that we actually have enough byte left to produce a match at all os fuzz issue 9406

key fix termination condition in assoc array garbage collection this fix cve 2014 3631 it is possible for an associative array to end up with a shortcut node at the root of the tree if there are more than fan out leaf in the tree but they all crowd into the same slot in the lowest level ie they all have the same first nibble of their index key when assoc_array_gc return back up the tree after scanning some leaf it can fall off of the root and crash because it assumes that the back pointer from a shortcut after label ascend_old_tree must point to a normal node which isn t true of a shortcut node at the root should we find we re ascending rootwards over a shortcut we should check to see if the backpointer is zero and if it is we have completed the scan this particular bug cannot occur if the root node is not a shortcut ie if you have fewer than 17 key in a keyring or if you have at least two key that sit into separate slot eg a keyring and a non keyring this can be reproduced by ring keyctl newring bar s for i 1 i 18 i do last_key keyctl newring foo i ring done keyctl timeout last_key 2 doing this echo 3 proc sys kernel key gc_delay first will speed thing up if we do fall off of the top of the tree we get the following oops bug unable to handle kernel null pointer dereference at 0000000000000018 ip ffffffff8136cea7 assoc_array_gc 0x2f7 0x540 pgd dae15067 pud cfc24067 pmd 0 llc fix missing msg_namelen update in llc_ui_recvmsg for stream socket the code miss to update the msg_namelen member to 0 and therefore make net socket c leak the local uninitialized sockaddr_storage variable to userland 128 byte of kernel stack memory the msg_namelen update is also missing for datagram socket in case the socket is shutting down during receive fix both issue by setting msg_namelen to 0 early it will be updated later if we re going to fill the msg_name member cc arnaldo carvalho de melo acme ghostprotocols net signed off by mathias krause minipli googlemail com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

kvm x86 reload pit counter for all channel when restoring state currently if userspace restores the pit counter with a count of 0 on channel 1 or 2 and the guest attempt to read the count on those channel then kvm will perform a mod of 0 and crash this will ensure that 0 value are converted to 65536 a per the spec this is cve 2015 7513 signed off by andy honig ahonig google com signed off by paolo bonzini pbonzini redhat com

ext4 allocate entire range in zero range currently there is a bug in zero range code which cause zero range call to only allocate block aligned portion of the range while ignoring the rest in some case in some case namely if the end of the range is past i_size we do attempt to preallocate the last nonaligned block however this might cause kernel to bug in some carefully designed zero range request on setup where page size block size fix this problem by first preallocating the entire range including the nonaligned edge and converting the written extent to unwritten in the next step this approach will also give u the advantage of having the range to be a linearly contiguous a possible signed off by lukas czerner lczerner redhat com signed off by theodore t o tytso mit edu

net sctp fix panic on duplicate asconf chunk when receiving a e g semi good formed connection scan in the form of init asconf asconf_ack init ack asconf asconf_ack cookie echo cookie ack asconf_a asconf_b where asconf_a equal asconf_b chunk at least both serial need to be equal we panic an sctp server the problem is that good formed asconf chunk that we reply with asconf_ack chunk are cached per serial thus when we receive a same asconf chunk twice e g through a lost asconf_ack we do not need to process them again on the server side that wa the idea also proposed in the rfc instead we know it wa cached and we just resend the cached chunk instead so far so good where thing get nasty is in sctp s side effect interpreter that is sctp_cmd_interpreter while incoming asconf_a chunk event_arg is being marked end_of_packet and singleton and we have an association context we do not flush the outqueue the first time after processing the asconf_ack singleton chunk via sctp_cmd_reply instead we keep it queued up although we set local_cork to 1 commit 2e3216cd54b1 changed the precedence so that a long a we get bundled incoming chunk we try possible bundling on outgoing queue a well before this commit we would just flush the output queue now while asconf_a s asconf_ack sits in the corked outq we continue to process the same asconf_b chunk from the packet a we have cached the previous asconf_ack we find it grab it and do another sctp_cmd_reply command on it so effectively we rip the chunk list pointer and requeue the same asconf_ack chunk another time since we process asconf_b it s correctly marked with end_of_packet and we enforce an uncork and thus flush thus crashing the kernel fix it by testing if the asconf_ack is currently pending and if that is the case do not requeue it when flushing the output queue we may relink the chunk for preparing an outgoing packet but eventually unlink it when it s copied into the skb right before transmission joint work with vlad yasevich fix 2e3216cd54b1 sctp follow security requirement of responding with 1 packet signed off by daniel borkmann dborkman redhat com signed off by vlad yasevich vyasevich gmail com signed off mm thp fix dev zero map_private and vm_flags cleanup the huge_memory c thp page fault wa allowed to run if vm_ops wa null which would succeed for dev zero map_private a the f_op mmap wouldn t setup a special vma vm_ops and it would fallback to regular anonymous memory but other thp logic weren t fully activated for vmas with vm_file not null dev zero ha a not null vma vm_file so this remove the vm_file check so that dev zero also can safely use thp the other albeit safer approach to fix this bug would have been to prevent the thp initial page fault to run if vm_file wa set after removing the vm_file check this also make huge_memory c stricter in khugepaged for the debug_vm y case it doesn t replace the vm_file check with a is_pfn_mapping check but it keep checking for vm_pfnmap under vm_bug_on because for a is_cow_mapping mapping vm_pfnmap should only be allowed to exist before the first page fault and in turn when vma anon_vma is null so preventing khugepaged registration so i tend to think the previous comment saying if vm_file wa set vm_pfnmap might have been set and we could still be registered in khugepaged despite anon_vma wa not null to be registered in khugepaged wa too paranoid the is_linear_pfn_mapping check is also i think superfluous a described by comment but under debug_vm it is safe to stay address http bugzilla kernel org show_bug cgi id 33682 signed off by andrea arcangeli aarcange redhat com reported by caspar zhang bug casparzhang com acked by mel gorman mel csn ul ie acked by rik van riel riel redhat com cc stable kernel org 2 6 38 x signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

ipv4 use new_gw for redirect neigh lookup in v2 6 ip_rt_redirect call arp_bind_neighbour which return 0 and then the state of the neigh for the new_gw is checked if the state isn t valid then the redirected route is deleted this behavior is maintained up to v3 5 7 by check_peer_redirect because rt rt_gateway is assigned to peer redirect_learned a4 before calling ipv4_neigh_lookup after commit 5943634fc559 ipv4 maintain redirect and pmtu info in struct rtable again ipv4_neigh_lookup is performed without the rt_gateway assigned to the new_gw in the case when rt_gateway old_gw isn t zero the function us it a the key the neigh is most likely valid since the old_gw is the one that sends the icmp redirect message then the new_gw is assigned to fib_nh_exception the problem is the new_gw arp may never get resolved and the traffic is blackholed so use the new_gw for neigh lookup change from v1 use __ipv4_neigh_lookup instead per eric dumazet fix 5943634fc559 ipv4 maintain redirect and pmtu info in struct rtable again signed off by stephen suryaputra lin ssurya ieee org signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

ret_from_fork 0x25 0x30 when early abort is occurred due to invalid acpi information linux kernel terminates acpi by calling acpi_terminate function the function call acpi_ns_terminate function to delete namespace data and acpi operand cache acpi_gbl_module_code_list but the deletion code in acpi_ns_terminate function is wrapped in acpi_exec_app definition therefore the code is only executed xfrm_user ensure user supplied esn replay window is valid the current code fails to ensure that the netlink message actually contains a many byte a the header indicates if a user creates a new state or update an existing one but doe not supply the byte for the whole esn replay window the kernel copy random heap byte into the replay bitmap the one happen to follow the xfrma_replay_esn_val netlink attribute this lead to following issue 1 the replay window ha random bit set confusing the replay handling code later on 2 a malicious user could use this flaw to leak up to 3 5kb of heap memory when she ha access to the xfrm netlink interface requires cap_net_admin known user of the esn replay window are strongswan and steffen s iproute2 patch http patchwork ozlabs org patch 85962 the latter us the interface with a bitmap supplied while the former doe not strongswan is therefore prone to run into issue 1 to fix both issue without breaking existing userland allow using the xfrma_replay_esn_val netlink attribute with either an empty bitmap or a fully specified one for the former case we initialize the in kernel bitmap with zero for the latter we copy the user supplied bitmap for state update the full bitmap must be supplied to prevent overflow in the bitmap length calculation the maximum size of bmp_len is limited to 128 by this patch resulting in a maximum replay window of 4096 packet this should be sufficient for all real life scenario rfc 4303 recommends a default replay window size of 64 cc steffen klassert steffen klassert secunet com cc martin willi martin revosec ch cc ben hutchings bhutchings solarflare com signed off by mathias krause minipli googlemail com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

add selector terminus for file_content file_metadata this terminus is now the default and encapsulates the behavior that wa previously in the indirectionhooks that is we dynamically select the terminus to use for a file request based on the key however for the puppet master we instead explicitly always use the fileserver terminus so that all request for file from the master will go through the file server this ensures that we will never accidentally serve local file on the puppet master

fix double free oob write while receiving ipc data if a malicious client pretend to be the e17 window manager it is possible to trigger an out of boundary heap write while receiving an ipc message the length of the already received message is stored in an unsigned short which overflow after receiving 64 kb of data it s comparably small amount of data and therefore achievable for an attacker when len overflow realloc will either be called with a small value and therefore char will be appended out of bound or len 1 will be exactly 0 in which case realloc behaves like free this could be abused for a later double free attack a it s even possible to overwrite the free information but this depends on the malloc implementation signed off by tobias stoeckmann tobias stoeckmann org

perf x86 add hw_watchdog_set_attr in a sake of nmi watchdog on p4 due to restriction and specific of netburst pmu we need a separated event for nmi watchdog in particular every netburst event consumes not just a counter and a config register but also an additional escr register since escr register are grouped upon counter i e if escr is occupied for some event there is no room for another event to enter until it released we need to pick up the least used escr or the most available one for nmi watchdog purpose so msr_p4_cru_escr2 3 wa chosen with this patch nmi watchdog and perf top should be able to run simultaneously signed off by cyrill gorcunov gorcunov openvz org cc lin ming ming m lin intel com cc arnaldo carvalho de melo acme redhat com cc frederic weisbecker fweisbec gmail com tested and reviewed by don zickus dzickus redhat com tested and reviewed by stephane eranian eranian google com signed off by peter zijlstra a p zijlstra chello nl link http lkml kernel org r 20110623124918 gc13050 sun signed off by ingo molnar mingo elte hu

fix double free in gdimagewebptr the issue is that gdimagewebpctx which is called by gdimagewebpptr and the other webp output function to do the real work doe not return whether it succeeded or failed so this is not checked in gdimagewebpptr and the function wrongly assumes everything is okay which is not in this case because there is a size limitation for webp namely that the width and height must by le than 16383 we can t change the signature of gdimagewebpctx for api compatibility reason so we introduce the static helper _gdimagewebpctx which return success respective failure so gdimagewebpptr and gdimagewebpptrex can check the return value we leave it solely to libwebp for now to report warning regarding the failing write this issue had been reported by ibrahim el sayed to security libgd org cve 2016 6912

btrfs fix hash overflow handling the handling for directory crc hash overflow wa fairly obscure split_leaf return eoverflow when we try to extend the item and that is supposed to bubble up to userland for a while it did so but along the way we added better handling of error and forced the f readonly if we hit io error during the directory insertion along the way we started testing only for eexist and the eoverflow case wa dropped the end result is that we may force the f readonly if we catch a directory hash bucket overflow this fix a few problem spot first i add test for eoverflow in the place where we can safely just return the error up the chain btrfs_rename is harder though because it try to insert the new directory item only after it ha already unlinked anything the rename wa going to overwrite rather than adding very complex logic i added a helper to test for the hash overflow case early while it is still safe to bail out snapshot and subvolume creation had a similar problem so they are using the new helper now too signed off by chris mason chris mason fusionio com reported by pascal junod pascal junod info

fix remember me cookie the security configuration in etc security mh_default_org xml enables a remember me cookie based on a hash created from the username password and an additional system key opencast ha hard coded this system key in the large xml file and never mention to change this basically ensuring that all system use the same key sec remember me key opencast user service ref userdetailsservice this mean that an attacker getting access to a remember me token for one server can get access to all server which allow log in using the same credential without ever needing the credential for example a remember me token obtained from develop opencast org can be used on stable opencast org without actually knowing the log in credential such an attack will usually not work on different installation assuming that safe unique password are used but it is basically guaranteed to work to get access to all machine of one cluster if a token from one machine is compromised this patch now make opencast automatically generate a safe key based on unique system property creating a safe zero configuration variant of the remember me token this patch additionally switch from using md5 for the token to using sha 512 instead to also be more resilient against brute force attack in case an attacker get access to such a token

avoid repeated name lookup during table and index ddl if the name lookup come to different conclusion due to concurrent activity we might perform some part of the ddl on a different table than other part at least in the case of create index this can be used to cause the permission check to be performed against a different table than the index creation allowing for a privilege escalation attack this change the calling convention for defineindex createtrigger transformindexstmt transformaltertablestmt checkindexcompatible in 9 2 and newer and altertable in 9 1 and older in addition checkrelationownership is removed in 9 2 and newer and the calling convention is changed in older branch a field ha also been added to the constraint node fkconstraint in 8 4 third party code calling these function or using the constraint node will require updating report by andres freund patch by robert haas and andres freund reviewed by tom lane security cve 2014 0062

mm madvise c fix madvise infinite loop under special circumstance madvise_willneed ha always been a noop for dax formerly xip mapping unfortunately madvise_willneed doesn t communicate this information properly to the generic madvise syscall implementation the calling convention is quite subtle there madvise_vma is supposed to either return an error or update prev otherwise the main loop will never advance to the next vma and it will keep looping for ever without a way to get out of the kernel it seems this ha been broken since introduction nobody ha noticed because nobody seems to be using madvise_willneed on these dax mapping mhocko suse com rewrite changelog link http lkml kernel org r 20171127115318 911 1 guoxuenan huawei com fix fe77ba6f4f97 patch xip madvice fadvice execute in place signed off by chenjie chenjie6 huawei com signed off by guoxuenan guoxuenan huawei com acked by michal hocko mhocko suse com cc minchan kim minchan kernel org cc zhangyi f yi zhang huawei com cc miao xie miaoxie huawei com cc mike rapoport rppt linux vnet ibm com cc shaohua li shli fb com cc andrea arcangeli aarcange redhat com cc mel gorman mgorman techsingularity net cc kirill a shutemov kirill shutemov linux intel com cc david rientjes rientjes google com cc anshuman khandual khandual linux vnet ibm com cc rik van riel riel redhat com cc carsten otte cotte de ibm com cc dan williams dan j williams intel com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by andrew morton akpm linux foundation org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

mm tighten x86 dev mem with zeroing read under config_strict_devmem reading system ram through dev mem is disallowed however on x86 the first 1mb wa always allowed for bios and similar thing regardless of it actually being system ram it wa possible for heap to end up getting allocated in low 1mb ram and then read by thing like x86info or dd which would trip hardened usercopy usercopy kernel memory exposure attempt detected from ffff880000090000 dma kmalloc 256 4096 byte this change the x86 exception for the low 1mb by reading back zero for system ram area instead of blindly allowing them more work is needed to extend this to mmap but currently mmap doesn t go through usercopy so hardened usercopy won t oops the kernel reported by tommi rantala tommi t rantala nokia com tested by tommi rantala tommi t rantala nokia com signed off by kees cook keescook chromium org

kvm iommu fix the third parameter of kvm_iommu_put_pages cve 2014 3601 the third parameter of kvm_iommu_put_pages is wrong it should be gfn slot base_gfn by making gfn very large malicious guest or userspace can cause kvm to go to this error path and subsequently to pas a huge value a size alternatively if gfn is small then page would be pinned but never unpinned causing host memory leak and local do passing a reasonable but large value could be the most dangerous case because it would unpin a page that should have stayed pinned and thus allow the device to dma into arbitrary memory however this cannot happen because of the condition that can trigger the error out of memory where you can t allocate even a single page should not be possible for the attacker to trigger when exceeding the iommu s address space guest page after gfn will also exceed the iommu s address space and inside kvm_iommu_put_pages the iommu_iova_to_phys will fail the page thus would not be unpinned at all reported by jack morgenstein jackm mellanox com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by michael s tsirkin mst redhat com signed off by paolo bonzini pbonzini redhat com

remained the same a that of the old task due to the memcpy in dup_mm ldt_struct s are not intended to be shared so a use after free occurred after one task exited fix the bug by making s390 fix kernel crash due to linkage stack instruction the kernel currently crash with a low address protection exception if a user space process executes an instruction that try to use the linkage stack set the base aste origin and the subspace aste origin of the dispatchable unit control table to point to a dummy aste set up control register 15 to point to an empty linkage stack with no room left a user space process with a linkage stack instruction will still crash but with a different exception which is correctly translated to a segmentation fault instead of a kernel oops signed off by martin schwidefsky schwidefsky de ibm com

net rework recvmsg handler msg_name and msg_namelen logic this patch now always pass msg msg_namelen a 0 recvmsg handler must set msg_namelen to the proper size sizeof struct sockaddr_storage to return msg_name to the user this prevents numerous uninitialized memory leak we had in the recvmsg handler and make it harder for new code to accidentally leak uninitialized memory optimize for the case recvfrom is called with null a address we don t need to copy the address at all so set it to null before invoking the recvmsg handler we can do so because all the recvmsg handler must cope with the case a plain read is called on them read also set msg_name to null also document these change in include linux net h a suggested by david miller change since rfc set msg msg_name null if user specified a null in msg_name but had a non null msg_namelen in verify_iovec verify_compat_iovec this doesn t affect sendto a it would bail out earlier while trying to copy in the address it also more naturally reflects the logic by the caller of verify_iovec with this change in place i could remove if uaddr msg_sys msg_namelen 0 msg msg_name null this change doe not alter the user visible error logic a we ignore msg_namelen a long a msg_name is null also remove two unnecessary curly bracket in ___sys_recvmsg and change comment to netdev style cc david miller davem davemloft net suggested by eric dumazet eric dumazet gmail com signed off by hannes frederic sowa hannes stressinduktion org signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

set_fat move fat12 next cluster check up in fat12 two 12 bit entry are combined to a 24 bit value three byte therefore when an even numbered fat entry is set in fat12 it must be be combined with the following entry to prevent accessing beyond the end of the fat array it must be checked that the cluster is not the last one this check wa broken in ff1b24e9 first included in 3 0 3 a the lookup wa done unconditionally and the check influenced only using the looked up value move the check up to fix signed off by andreas bombe aeb debian org

replace readline completion it seems like i ve been frustrated by readline left and fucking right in this case using readline completion the completer function get called to populate a list of string that s cool but it get called every single time the displayed completion change even if the prefix is the same this fall flat on it face in term of performance with more than a few hundred completion i m not sure if it s readline interacting with python that s adding so much overhead but if it s taking like 30 millisecond to generate the completion and over a second to feed it into readline then there s a problem so i just stopped using it for completion since i had to subsequently hack in custom getc support and all of the completion generating infrastructure wa present it wa pretty trivial if it wasn t for line editing i d nix the entire library gladly i also got rid of help text on completion because it ha started to seem useless and the hook disappeared now help is way better this might make a reappearance however

x86 bpf_jit fix compilation of large bpf program x86 ha variable length encoding x86 jit compiler is trying to pick the shortest encoding for given bpf instruction while doing so the jump target are changing so jit is doing multiple pass over the program typical program need 3 pass some very short program converge with 2 pass large program may need 4 or 5 but specially crafted bpf program may hit the pas limit and if the program converges on the last iteration the jit compiler will be producing an image full of int 3 insns fix this corner case by doing final iteration over bpf program fix 0a14842f5a3c net filter just in time compiler for x86 64 reported by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net signed off by alexei starovoitov ast plumgrid com tested by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net acked by daniel borkmann daniel iogearbox net signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

rar5 reader reject file that declare invalid header flag one of the field in rar5 s base block structure is the size of the header some invalid file declare a 0 header size setting which can confuse the unpacker minimum header size for rar5 base block is 7 byte 4 byte for crc and 3 byte for the rest so block size of 0 byte should be rejected at header parsing stage the fix add an error condition if header size of 0 byte is detected in this case the unpacker will not attempt to unpack the file a the header is corrupted the commit also add ossfuzz 20459 sample to test further regression in this area

ibmvnic fix initial mtu setting in the current driver the mtu is set to the maximum value capable for the backing device this decision turned out to be a mistake a it led to confusion among user the expected initial mtu value used for other ibm vnic capable operating system is 1500 with the maximum value 9000 reserved for when jumbo frame are enabled this patch set the mtu to the default value for a net device it also corrects a discrepancy between mtu value received from firmware which includes the ethernet header length and net device mtu value finally it remove redundant min max mtu assignment after device initialization signed off by thomas falcon tlfalcon linux vnet ibm com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

key prevent creating a different user s keyrings it wa possible for an unprivileged user to create the user and user session keyrings for another user for example sudo u 3000 sh c keyctl add keyring _uid 4000 u keyctl add keyring _uid_ses 4000 u sleep 15 sleep 1 sudo u 4000 keyctl describe u sudo u 4000 keyctl describe u this is problematic because these fake keyrings won t have the right permission in particular the user who created them first will own them and will have full access to them via the possessor permission which can be used to compromise the security of a user s key 4 alswrv v 3000 0 keyring _uid 4000 5 alswrv v 3000 0 keyring _uid_ses 4000 fix it by marking user and user session keyrings with a flag key_flag_uid_keyring then when searching for a user or user session keyring by name skip all keyrings that don t have the flag set fix 69664cf16af4 key don t generate user and user session keyrings unless they re accessed cc stable vger kernel org v2 6 26 signed off by eric biggers ebiggers google com signed off by david howells dhowells redhat com

remove support for non crlf line ending http tool ietf org html rfc7230 section 3 5 say that server may implement their parser to use only the lf a a delimeter between line however if the frontend server doe not do the same you can potentially allow a single http request to be treated differently by the two server this issue can be used to cause http request smuggling or http desync which may lead to vulnerability to increase robustness waitress will no longer allow bare lf for http message header and chunked encoding and instead now enforces that the line ending at crlf

kvm x86 prefetch and hint_nop should have srcmem flag the decode phase of the x86 emulator assumes that every instruction with the modrm flag and which can be used with rip relative addressing ha either srcmem or dstmem this is not the case for several instruction prefetch hint nop and clflush adding srcmem noaccess for prefetch and hint nop and srcmem for clflush this fix cve 2014 8480 fix 41061cdb98a0bec464278b4db8e894a3121671f5 cc stable vger kernel org signed off by nadav amit namit c technion ac il signed off by paolo bonzini pbonzini redhat com

vfs make aio use the proper rw_verify_area area helper we had for some reason overlooked the aio interface and it didn t use the proper rw_verify_area helper function that check for example mandatory locking on the file and that the size of the access doesn t cause u to overflow the provided offset limit etc instead aio did just the security_file_permission thing that rw_verify_area also doe directly this fix it to do all the proper helper function which not only mean that now mandatory file locking work with aio too we can actually remove line of code reported by manish honap manish_honap_vit yahoo co in cc stable vger kernel org signed off by linus torvalds torvalds linux foundation org

kdc null deref due to referral cve 2013 1417 an authenticated remote client can cause a kdc to crash by making a valid tgs req to a kdc serving a realm with a single component name the process_tgs_req function dereferences a null pointer because an unusual failure condition cause a helper function to return success while attempting to provide cross realm referral for host based service principal the find_referral_tgs function could return a tgs principal for a zero length realm name indicating that the hostname in the service principal ha no known realm associated with it subsequently the find_alternate_tgs function would attempt to construct a path to this empty string realm and return success along with a null pointer in it output parameter this happens because krb5_walk_realm_tree return a list of length one when it attempt to construct a transit path between a single component realm and the empty string realm this list cause a loop in find_alternate_tgs to iterate over zero element resulting in the unexpected output of a null pointer which process_tgs_req proceeds to dereference because there is no error condition add an error condition to find_referral_tgs when krb5_get_host_realm return an empty realm name also add an error condition to find_alternate_tgs to handle the length one output from krb5_walk_realm_tree the vulnerable configuration is not likely to arise in practice realm name that have a single component are likely to be test realm release prior to krb5 1 11 are not vulnerable thanks to sol jerome for reporting this problem cvssv2 av n ac m au s c n i n a p e h rl o rc c cherry picked from commit 3c7f1c21ffaaf6c90f1045f0f5440303c766acc0 ticket 7668 version_fixed 1 11 4 status resolved

net fix kernel deadlock with interface rename and netdev name retrieval when the kernel compiled with config_preempt n is performing the rename of a network interface it can end up waiting for a workqueue to complete if userland is able to invoke a siocgifname ioctl or a so_bindtodevice getsockopt in between the kernel will deadlock due to the fact that read_secklock_begin will spin forever waiting for the writer process the one doing the interface rename to update the devnet_rename_seq sequence this patch fix the problem by adding a helper netdev_get_name and using it in the code handling the siocgifname ioctl and so_bindtodevice setsockopt the netdev_get_name helper us raw_seqcount_begin to avoid spinning forever waiting for devnet_rename_seq sequence to become even cond_resched is used in the contended case before retrying the access to give the writer process a chance to finish the use of raw_seqcount_begin will incur some unneeded work in the reader process in the contended case but this is better than deadlocking the system signed off by nicolas schichan nschichan freebox fr acked by eric dumazet edumazet google com signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net

mercurial reject malicious command argument 27516 we ve got a security report from the phabricator team which basically say config and debugger argument can be injected anywhere to lead to an arbitrary command execution http secure phabricator com rpa7921a4448093d00defa8bd18f35b8c8f8bf3314 this is a fundamental issue of the argument parsing rule in mercurial which allows extension to populate their parsing rule and such extension can be loaded by config extension name there s a chicken and egg problem we re working on hardening the parsing rule but which won t come in by default a it would be a behavior change this patch add a verification to reject malicious command argument a a last ditch the subsequent patch will fix the problem in more appropriate way contributed by yuya nishihara git svn id http svn redmine org redmine trunk 17060 e93f8b46 1217 0410 a6f0 8f06a7374b81

crypto hmac require that the underlying hash algorithm is unkeyed because the hmac template didn t check that it underlying hash algorithm is unkeyed trying to use hmac hmac sha3 512 generic through af_alg or through keyctl_dh_compute resulted in the inner hmac being used without having been keyed resulting in sha3_update being called without sha3_init causing a stack buffer overflow this is a very old bug but it seems to have only started causing real problem when sha 3 support wa added requires config_crypto_sha3 because the innermost hash s state is import ed from a zeroed buffer and it just so happens that other hash algorithm are fine with that but sha 3 is not however there could be arch or hardware dependent hash algorithm also affected i couldn t test everything fix the bug by introducing a function crypto_shash_alg_has_setkey which test whether a shash algorithm is keyed then update the hmac template to require that it underlying hash algorithm is unkeyed here is a acpi disable apei error injection if securelevel is set acpi provides an error injection mechanism einj for debugging and testing the acpi platform error interface apei and other ra feature if supported by the firmware acpi specification 5 0 and later provide for a way to specify a physical memory address to which to inject the error injecting error through einj can produce error which to the platform are indistinguishable from real hardware error this can have undesirable side effect such a causing the platform to mark hardware a needing replacement while it doe not provide a method to load unauthenticated privileged code the effect of these error may persist across reboots and affect trust in the underlying hardware so disable error injection through einj if securelevel is set signed off by linn crosetto linn hpe com

mnt correct permission check in do_remount while invesgiating the issue where in mount bind oremount ro would result in later mount bind oremount rw succeeding even if the mount started off locked i realized that there are several additional mount flag that should be locked and are not in particular mnt_nosuid mnt_nodev mnt_noexec and the atime flag in addition to mnt_readonly should all be locked these flag are all per superblock can all be changed with ms_bind and should not be changable if set by a more privileged user the following addition to the current logic are added in this patch nosuid may not be clearable by a le privileged user nodev may not be clearable by a le privielged user noexec may not be clearable by a le privileged user atime flag may not be changeable by a le privileged user the logic with atime is that always setting atime on access is a global policy and backup software and auditing software could break if atime bit are not updated when they are configured to be updated and serious performance degradation could result do attack if atime update happen when they have been explicitly disabled therefore an unprivileged user should not be able to mess with the atime bit set by a more privileged user the additional restriction are implemented with the addition of mnt_lock_nosuid mnt_lock_nodev mnt_lock_noexec and mnt_lock_atime mnt flag taken together these change and the fix for mnt_lock_readonly should make it safe for an unprivileged user to create a user namespace and to call mount bind o remount without the danger of mount flag being changed maliciously cc stable vger kernel org acked by serge e hallyn serge hallyn ubuntu com signed off by eric w biederman ebiederm xmission com

jbd2 fix potential memory leak on transaction commit there is potential memory leak of journal head in function jbd2_journal_commit_transaction the problem is that jbd2 will not reclaim the journal head of commit record if error occurs or journal is abotred i use the following script to reproduce this issue on a rhel6 system i found it very easy to reproduce with async commit enabled mount dev sdb mnt o journal_checksum journal_async_commit touch mnt xxx echo offline sys block sdb device state sync umount mnt rmmod ext4 rmmod jbd2 removal of the jbd2 module will make slab complaining that cache jbd2_journal_head can t free all object signed off by zhang huan zhhuan gmail com signed off by theodore t o tytso mit edu

iso9660 fail when expected rockridge extension is missing a corrupted or malicious iso9660 image can cause read_ce to loop forever read_ce call parse_rockridge expecting a rockridge extension to be read however parse_rockridge is structured a a while loop starting with a sanity check and if the sanity check fails before the loop ha run the function return archive_ok without advancing the position in the file this cause read_ce to retry indefinitely make parse_rockridge return archive_warn if it didn t read an extension a someone with no real knowledge of the format this seems more apt than archive_fatal but both the call site escalate it to a fatal error immediately anyway found with a combination of afl afl rb fairfuzz and qsym

lockd fix lockd shutdown race a reported by david jeffery a signal wa sent to lockd while lockd wa shutting down from a request to stop nfs the signal cause lockd to call restart_grace which put the lockd_net structure on the grace list if this signal is received at the wrong time it will occur after lockd_down_net ha called locks_end_grace but before lockd_down_net stop the lockd thread this lead to lockd putting the lockd_net structure back on the grace list then exiting without anything removing it from the list so perform the final locks_end_grace from the the lockd thread this ensures it s serialized with respect to restart_grace reported by david jeffery djeffery redhat com signed off by j bruce field bfields redhat com

arm64 treat unhandled compat el0 trap a undef currently if a compat process read or writes from to a disabled cp15 cp14 register the trap is not handled by the el0_sync_compat handler and the kernel will head to bad_mode where it will die and oops for 64 bit process disabled system register access are currently treated a unhandled instruction this patch modifies entry s to treat these unhandled trap a undefined instruction sending a sigill to userspace this give process a chance to handle this and stop using inaccessible register and prevents further issue in the kernel a a result of the die reported by johannes jensen johannes jensen arm com signed off by mark rutland mark rutland arm com signed off by catalin marina catalin marina arm com

s390 mm four page table level v fork the fork of a process with four page table level is broken since git commit 6252d702c5311ce9 s390 dynamic page table all new mm context are created with three page table level and an asce limit of 4tb if the parent ha four level dup_mmap will add vmas to the new context which are outside of the asce limit the subsequent call to copy_page_range will walk the three level page table structure of the new process with non zero pgd and pud index this lead to memory clobber a the pgd_index and the pud_index is added to the mm pgd pointer without a pgd_deref in between the init_new_context function is selecting the number of page table level for a new context the function is used by mm_init which in turn is called by dup_mm and mm_alloc these two are used by fork and exec the init_new_context function can distinguish the two case by looking at mm context asce_limit for fork the mm struct ha been copied and the number of page table level may not change for exec the mm_alloc function set the new mm structure to zero in this case a three level page table is created a the temporary stack space is located at stack_top_max 4tb this fix cve 2016 2143 reported by marcin kościelnicki koriakin 0x04 net reviewed by heiko carstens heiko carstens de ibm com cc stable vger kernel org signed off by martin schwidefsky schwidefsky de ibm com

perf remove the nmi parameter from the swevent and overflow interface the nmi parameter indicated if we could do wakeups from the current context if not we would set some state and self ipi and let the resulting interrupt do the wakeup for the various event class hardware nmi 0 pmi is in fact an nmi or we run irq_work_run from the pmi tail arm etc tracepoint nmi 0 since tracepoint could be from nmi context software nmi 0 1 some like the schedule thing cannot perform wakeups and hence need 0 a one can see there is very little nmi 1 usage and the down side of not using it is that on some platform some software event can have a jiffy delay in wakeup when arch_irq_work_raise isn t implemented the up side however is that we can remove the nmi parameter and save a bunch of conditionals in fast path signed off by peter zijlstra a p zijlstra chello nl cc michael cree mcree orcon net nz cc will deacon will deacon arm com cc deng cheng zhu dengcheng zhu gmail com cc anton blanchard anton samba org cc eric b munson emunson mgebm net cc heiko carstens heiko carstens de ibm com cc paul mundt lethal linux sh org cc david s miller davem davemloft net cc frederic weisbecker fweisbec gmail com cc jason wessel jason wessel windriver com cc don zickus dzickus redhat com link http lkml kernel org n tip agjev8eu666tvknpb3iaj0fg git kernel org signed off by ingo molnar mingo elte hu

pki fix http www kb cert org vuls id 403768 this commit effectively fix http www kb cert org vuls id 403768 cve 2017 13083 a it is described per it revision 11 which is the latest revision at the time of this commit by disabling window prompt enacted during signature validation that allow the user to bypass the intended signature verification check it need to be pointed out that the vulnerability allow ing the use of a self signed certificate which relies on the end user actively ignoring a window prompt that tell them that the update failed the signature validation whilst also advising against running it is being fully addressed even a the update protocol remains http it also need to be pointed out that the extended delay 48 hour between the time the vulnerability wa reported and the moment it is fixed in our codebase ha to do with the fact that the reporter chose to deviate from standard security practice by not disclosing the detail of the vulnerability with u be it publicly or privately before creating the cert org report the only advance notification we received wa a generic note about the use of http v http which a have established is not immediately relevant to addressing the reported vulnerability close 1009 note the other vulnerability scenario described towards the end of 1009 which doesn t have to do with the lack of ca checking will be addressed separately

ipv4 try to cache dst_entries which would cause a redirect not caching dst_entries which cause redirects could be exploited by host on the same subnet causing a severe do attack this effect aggravated since commit f88649721268999 ipv4 fix dst race in sk_dst_get lookup causing redirects will be allocated with dst_nocache set which will force dst_release to free them via rcu unfortunately waiting for rcu grace period just take too long we can end up with 1m dst_entries waiting to be released and the system will run oom rcuos thread cannot catch up under high softirq load attaching the flag to emit a redirect later on to the specific skb allows u to cache those dst_entries thus reducing the pressure on allocation and deallocation this issue wa discovered by marcelo leitner cc julian anastasov ja ssi bg signed off by marcelo leitner mleitner redhat com signed off by florian westphal fw strlen de signed off by hannes frederic sowa hannes stressinduktion org signed off by julian anastasov ja ssi bg signed off by david s miller davem davemloft net
